1.content: It's a size-related adventure for the monsters and humans of the Underground, but where will we begin?
1.title: The Underground

choices: Undyne, fish-like lady and Captain of the Royal Guard
Toriel, motherly guardian of the Ruins
11.content:
Growth for the lady monsters, then?
Take your pick.
11.title: Giant Monster Gals

111.content: We're here for the loud, proud, all-'round badass of the Royal Guard, eh?
111.title: Undyne

choices: Undyne's grown so large that she barely fits into the lab.
She's so big that she's broken right out of the building.
1111.content:
Maybe patience wasn't something Undyne was especially good about.
And maybe it wasn't such a good thing that her lack of patience was leading to a desire to grab the nearest heavy object in the cluttered lab around her and suplex it into the floor just for fun.
At least she only wanted to do it. As long as she restrained herself, things would be fine.
"We're just about ready, Undyne!" came the frazzled-sounding voice of Alphys, the former Royal Scientist, -- and Undyne's steady girlfriend -- who seemed to be able to tell when Undyne was feeling impatient.
Undyne herself, still sitting on the edge of a vacant desk, was idly flipping a lightning-blue glowing spear in her grip. She gave a combination growl-sigh.
"Gotcha, Alphys." she said. She'd been told something to the tune of "almost ready" about five or six times now.

It was a slow day for the former captain of the Underground's Royal Guard. A year and a half had now passed since the destruction of the Barrier and the exodus of the monsters from their age-old prison. Things were going very well for them by now. The monsters -- even the strangest-looking of the bunch -- had managed to integrate into human society over time, and progress was booming for both the humans and their new neighbors. With both human science and the incredible work of magic-infused monster science working together, both species were achieving things formerly thought impossible.
Yet the impossible becoming possible did little to improve on Undyne's ability to wait quietly.

"Alphyyyyys..." she grumbled, her summoned magic spear dissipating as the fish-like monster dropped her fist to her side.
The upper half of her girlfriend's face appeared from behind an impressive stack of papers to respond. "Sorry, sorry... I think I've got it now."
Alphys stepped out into view, clutching a small device -- looking to be built from a cell phone -- in her clawed hands.
"Ready? For real?" Undyne asked, cracking a sharp-toothed grin.
Her girlfriend nodded. "The calculations were the hardest part, but I think it's ready now."

The lizard monster switched on the device in her hands, which let off a buzzing sound as it powered up.
"Just... just summon one of your spears, OK...?" Alphys said distractedly, fiddling with the device. She managed to kill the buzzing sound, and looked back up toward Undyne, who had already brought another of her glowing spears into existence.
"Just like this, right? You said it'll make the spear huge?"
"Th-that's right." Alphys said. She coughed, readying the device. "Just hold it still, and the machine should be able to lock onto it just fine."
Undyne obeyed, swinging the spear around to her front.
"This is gonna be so kickass..." she said, still grinning widely. "Even better than our giant sword!"
"Y-yes..." Alphys agreed. She looked and sounded nervous, but Undyne trusted her work. "OK, ready? Three, two, one..."
The device let off a whoop of sound, and a beam of light, looking just like a bullet of magic, shot off toward Undyne's spear.

"W-whoa-!!" Undyne exclaimed. Her spear was emanating a more and more powerful glow as the seconds passed. "This is so freakin' cool!"
"J-just a few more seconds, Undyne!" Alphys said, trying to be heard over the sounds of the machine.
"What...?" Undyne shouted back, unable to hear her voice.
She saw Alphys' mouth move again, but still heard nothing. She frowned, her grip on her spear slackening. Was there something else she needed to do...?

"W-wait-!!" Alphys yelped, watching as the glowing spear slipped downward in Undyne's grip. "D-don't move it so much-!!"
"Damn it, I still can't hear you!" she heard Undyne shout back.
"Oh no..." Alphys muttered, watching the energy readout on the small screen of her device. A warning flashed up on the screen a moment later, and she gave a squeak of panic.

Without further warning, the device roared with noise, and a blinding flash of light burst forth from its emitter. Alphys was blinded, stumbling back as she dropped the device.
A cacophony of other sounds roared into her ears, and she clamped her hands over them to block it out.

 

"Nngh... Crap..."
Undyne clutched at her forehead, which was stinging dully. She blinked a few times, trying to shake off the last of the blinding light.
She'd fallen down at some point, and was sitting on an uncomfortable mess of some kind. Maybe she'd been knocked backward...
It wouldn't look very cool, that was for sure.
She was about to get to her feet when her vision cleared properly and she froze.
1111.title: An Excess of Undyne

choices: "No reason we can't have some fun like this, right?" Undyne asks.
"I'll help clean all this up, but then I'm taking a walk to the city."
11112.content:
"Uhh..."
Undyne stared at her surroundings, blinking in confusion.
She was outside. Alphys had a very nice lab out in the forest near the city, in the shadow of Mt. Ebott. It was quite a large building, too; they'd been lucky to score such a place from the humans.
But she knew she'd been inside the lab until ten seconds ago. Why could she see the trees?
And... why were the trees so small...?

She slowly looked down. There, she saw her shirt, jeans, and the pair of comfortable sneakers Alphys had suggested she buy a few weeks back.
More interesting, however, was everything scattered around her legs.
There was a colossal mess of what looked like broken concrete and sheets of metal in a disjointed array around her. She scanned over the sight for a few seconds before something clued her in.
It was the desk she'd just been sitting on, which was now lying on its side, one leg broken off.
The bigger problem was that the desk was about the size of two of her fingers.

Her spear had disappeared when she'd broken concentration, so if it didn't grow...
"A-Alphys-!!"
Undyne, still in a state of shock over finding herself increased to such a massive height that she must have outright destroyed the lab, began to frantically search the rubble for any sign of her girlfriend.
She found the remains of Alphys' work bench, a mangled assortment of blueprints and design sketches...
She heard the sound of a familiar cough, and looked toward the source of the noise. A yellow arm was sticking out from beneath a slab of concrete from the former roof.
"Shit-... Alphys!"
Undyne hastily pulled the fragment of concrete from the ground and tossed it aside.

Alphys was lying in a daze on one of the few untouched stretches of floor remaining. Undyne hovered a hand over her, concerned.
"Alphys?" she repeated.
Her girlfriend pushed herself to a sitting position and picked up her dropped glasses from the floor. Alphys let out a yelp of panic as Undyne suddenly took a grip on her body.
She squirmed as she was lifted from the ground to meet a yellow-coloured eye larger than her entire body.
"U-Undyne-!?" she squeaked.
"Shit, you scared me..." Undyne said, giving a relieved sigh.
"M-me-!? Look at you!!" her girlfriend replied.

She had a point. Alphys was small enough to fit into Undyne's palm.
"What happened?" Undyne asked, cradling her girlfriend carefully.
"Th-the device..." Alphys stammered, "It must've been overloaded by your magic... The energy levels spiked through the roof, a-and then..."
"So did I." Undyne said, managing a little smile.

Alphys slowly began to return to a normal breathing rate. Her lab was a pile of rubble, and her girlfriend looked to be about a third the size of Mt. Ebott. There was nothing OK about this, but she needed to stay calm.
"Th-the device-!" she exclaimed. She'd dropped it somewhere between their positions.
"Uhh... crap..." she heard Undyne mutter.
"Wh-what...?"
Undyne tilted her hand a bit, pointing to a spot on the floor. She'd moved her sneaker, revealing what little remained of the little device. A few shards of yellow metal were all that was still identifiable.
"Oh God..." Alphys said, colour draining from her face. "U-Undyne, it took me three weeks to finish that-!! Even without needing to redo the calculations, it'll...!"
"Wait, wait." Undyne stopped her. "You mean I'm stuck like this until you can rebuild it?"
"A-and I don't even have the lab, so who knows how long...!" Alphys was still panicking to herself. She only stopped once Undyne set a fingertip on her head, gently rubbing it over her scaly skin.
She looked up at her massive girlfriend's face.
Undyne was grinning. Alphys was normally happy to see that, but right now...?
11112.title: Right through the roof

choices: She's moving right on to the buildings around her.
111122.content:
"Wh-what!?" Alphys sputtered. "Y-you can't just go there now, you'll-!!"
"Ahh, c'mon." Undyne interrupted, only grinning more widely. "How many more times am I gonna get a chance like this?"

Her girlfriend was not moved. "U-Undyne, you're already stronger than all the humans we've ever met, and that's when you're at your normal size! You could cause so much damage if you went into the city, w-without even trying-!!"
"Aww," Undyne cooed, "You don't need to get so worked up over it, Alphys. Just for you, I promise I'll be extra careful once I get there."

Alphys still didn't look remotely convinced. She was fidgeting wildly, resting on Undyne's palm.
"I'm not hearing any more complaints!" Undyne went on. She raised her hand up to her face and planted a kiss on Alphys, her lips covering the majority of her girlfriend's body in one go.
Once she pulled away, Alphys was left dazed, wobbling in place. Undyne grinned at her and gently set her down at the edge of the clearing that housed the remains of her lab.
"OK, I'll get this cleaned up in no time -- just wait there."

 

Undyne's method of "cleaning" was characteristic of her, if rather different from what most people would probably think of.
She'd quickly gathered up the largest pieces of surviving equipment she could find and moved them into one massive pile at the opposite end of the clearing, and swept the remaining masses of broken materials and rubble into a spectacular junk pile elsewhere.
Finished, she swept her feet across the cracked floorspace a few times to knock aside any remaining debris.
Alphys was still watching from the edge of the area, nervousness all over her little face. Undyne crouched in front of her, still towering far over her head even like this.
"You can work with this, right?" Undyne asked.
"U-um... Well, y-yes, but it's going to-"
"Great!"
Undyne stood back up to her full and incredible height, leaving Alphys in her towering shadow.
"I'm heading into the city now. I'll be back later."
Alphys managed to summon one last burst of courage as Undyne's huge sneakers turned and began to walk away, her footfalls shaking the ground and producing an intimidating boom.
"W-wait!! Undyne!!"

But it was too late. Her behemoth of a girlfriend didn't hear her. Alphys hung her head, defeated.

 

Undyne stretched her stiff arms and legs a few times as she approached the edge of the city. She could see cars halting on the highway, their occupants staring at her in shock.

Within the city, those nearest to the outskirts could see the incredible sight for themselves.
Many recognized the towering fish-lady approaching the city as one of the first monsters to publicly reveal herself following their exodus from beneath Mt. Ebott a year and a half ago.
Inevitably, screams began to echo through the city as Undyne arrived, stopping at the outermost reaches of the city limits. Even the tallest buildings couldn't quite match her incredible height.
111122.title: Bound for the city

choices: Time to look for more promising buildings.
Undyne seeks out a different source of entertainment.
1111222.content:
Undyne smirked, looking over the cityscape with interest. She was taller than any building in the immediate area. Fitting in between them would probably be hard, too.
She glanced down. The flow of traffic had made an impressive reversal. Anyone right in front of her sneakers was making a hasty exit in the opposite direction. The monster standing overhead waited a short while for the cars to clear out before she stepped into the roadway. There was a little crunch as her foot obliterated a street lamp.
"Oops." she muttered. "Damn, those are gonna be tough to avoid."
There was something ahead that caught her interest. A construction site, where yet another towering building was going up. Undyne approached. The structure was clear of workers right now.
She'd promised Alphys that she'd be careful to avoid hurting people, but were half-finished buildings people? That was a big "no".

Positioning herself before the site, she looked it over. There was a crane on the edge of one of the structure's sides. She took a hold on it and lifted it right up easily.
"Wow." she remarked, moving the vehicle around effortlessly. Her strength really had gone right up alongside her size.
She had an idea. Moving her arms around the edges of the structure, she took a firm grip over the whole thing.
She couldn't help but feel disappointed as she flexed, causing the entire thing to break apart in her grip almost immediately.
"Man," she said with a sigh, "This thing sucked. Well, I'm doing them a favour, really. Who wants a crumbly building like that?"
1111222.title: Testing her strength

choices: Undyne plans out some more fun from here.
The building can't take her weight.
11112222.content:
Undyne could see a more open street about a block away. If she went there, she'd have more room and more options. Part of her hoped that Alphys would take a long while to get her device rebuilt; this felt like it was going to be way too much fun to give up right away.
There was an alleyway she could use to get to her goal. She slid a foot into the gap to make her way in sideways.
A noisy crash immediately followed her first motion. She grimaced, looking down. Her chest, relatively flat as it was, had made her too wide to fit.
Undyne weighed her options. Most of the other alleys and side roads were the same as this one.
With a shrug, she pushed through the distance remaining and reached the open street adjacent in seconds.
Down below, the alley was assaulted by a rain of metal and glass shards, which Undyne's body had violently torn through just a moment earlier.
The fish monster glanced around. A short building was resting at the back of the parking lot she'd stepped into. She turned and took a seat on the roof of the building, resting her legs across the open parking lot. Her sneakers easily plowed through the cars parked around.
11112222.title: Not quite a fit

choices: She carefully searches for anyone below her.
Crushing that was fun, and she wants to do more.
111122222.content:
It had barely been a few seconds since Undyne sat down when she felt an uncomfortable shift in the building she'd sat down on the roof of.
There was a splitting crack, and the roof caved in. Undyne hit the ground with a grunt of surprise.
She looked down. Her ass had pulverized the little building, punching right through the roof and down to ground level. She couldn't tell if there had been anyone inside.

1211.content: Frisk is an especially ambiguous blank slate of a character. So, you're free to establish any sort of age, gender, personality, and assorted traits from here on.
1211.title: Frisk

choices: Everything seems fine. (Frisk is slowly shrinking.)
The machine caused Frisk to shrink to a tiny size.
12111.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

 

"Dinner's still three hours off, Mom. I'll be back in less than one."
He had been en route to Alphys' lab, but this phone call was drawing out the visit by quite a lot. Frisk was dawdling by the edge of Alphys and Undyne's property, hoping that his adoptive mother, the Underground's former queen Toriel, would be satisfied with his promises sooner, rather than later.
The monsters had been free for nearly eight years now, but time had not made Toriel any less likely to worry over her son's well-being.
"Yes." he said for what felt like the tenth time. "And yes, I'll call you on the way home, too."
At last, Toriel sounded ready to let him go. "OK, talk to you then, Mom. Love you, too."
-beep-
Frisk made an impatient noise as he at last approached the large building that served as both Alphys' lab and a house which she shared with her long-time girlfriend, Undyne. He knew that his phone's signal would meet some interference once he went inside, so he'd chosen to wait on entering, but he hadn't expected Toriel to speak for so long.
At this rate, Frisk was half-expecting Undyne to arrive before he could even get in. Not to say that he didn't want to see Undyne as well, but talking to Alphys was the priority, and Undyne's presence would make that harder.

 

Frisk had come a long way from the eleven year-old orphan boy who took an unexpected fall on Mt. Ebott. He'd freed the monsters -- after a few RESETs and a whole lot of unfortunate deaths -- and helped his new friends rejoin society on the surface, where they'd lived happily for years now.
Frisk himself was eighteen now, soon-to-be nineteen. He was looking into plans for his future, but he sometimes wondered whether Toriel would ever actually let him leave their home.

 

The lab was filled with its usual hum of electrical equipment. Alphys was making quite a name for herself on the surface as the leading mind in human-monster science.
"Alphys?" Frisk called out over the noise. He heard no reply. He walked toward the doorway leading into the "house" section of the building and stuck his head through.
"Alphys...?"
Still nothing. Frisk sighed. Alphys had left the door unlocked, which made him hopeful that she'd be easy to find. He could wait until Undyne got here from her work day at the school. She'd know where her girlfriend was.
Frisk turned, and something caught his eye.
A new machine was sitting near Alphys' main work area. It was your standard giant science ray, it appeared. He wondered what it did, approaching.
He was barely within the machine's immediate area when it suddenly made a very loud noise like it was powering up.
"Uhh..."
Frisk didn't have time to consider moving back before the machine gave off another very loud sound and a beam of silver light burst from its front side.

Frisk blinked rapidly, a hand in front of his face as he tried to regain his senses. His vision slowly cleared.
12111.title: Consequences for Curiosity

choices: Frisk takes a chance and goes to find Toriel.
Toriel comes upstairs and enters the room.
The wait for Undyne's reply continues.
121111.content:
Frisk glanced around curiously once the light had faded from his vision. Nothing seemed amiss. The large machine was calming down now, its sounds becoming more peaceful.
(Well, I'll just consider that lucky and leave it...)
Frisk backed away and took a seat on a nearby chair to wait for Alphys' eventual return.

Undyne arrived first, just a few minutes later. She seemed a bit tired from her day of work at the school, but was still enthusiastic to see Frisk.
"Alphys?" she repeated once Frisk asked about her girlfriend's whereabouts. "She'd not gonna be back for a few more hours, probably."
"Hmm." Frisk sighed. "Well, could you check something with her for me once she gets here? Mom's gonna start to lose it if I'm late for dinner."

 

"Later, punk!!" Undyne's loud voice called as Frisk departed the lab shortly afterward.
Frisk paused at the edge of the property. The mailbox looked strange, somehow. Was it always that tall...? He shrugged to himself and pulled out his phone to text Toriel about his imminent return.

 

Something felt strange as he walked through the front door, back at home. His surroundings just looked off somehow, like they were all just a bit bigger than normal or something. Sure, the furniture was already pretty big to accommodate Toriel's height, but still...
"Hey, Mom!" Frisk called as he passed by the kitchen. It wasn't time to make dinner yet, but Toriel was already busying herself in the kitchen regardless. Cleaning, Frisk imagined.
He headed up the short staircase leading to the small second floor. He stumbled on the last stair.

Once inside his room, Frisk had to conclude that something was wrong. He thought back to the machine in Alphys' lab. Everything around him seemed bigger all of a sudden. Was he getting smaller...? It seemed just like Alphys to design a machine that could do that. Unfortunately, it also seemed like her to leave such a device active and unmarked.
He dug out his cell phone to text Undyne about it. The phone seemed normally sized, so he suspected that it had been affected, too.
Frisk composed a brief text about the device and sent it off to Undyne, before impatiently reeling back on the edge of his bed to wait on a reply.
Minutes passed. Frisk became gradually more nervous.
He was shrinking. There was no way around that. By his best guess, he was down to nearly half his normal height as he continued to wait on any reply from Undyne.
Another ten minutes still brought him nothing. What was he supposed to do? If he could avoid it, he didn't like to return to a SAVE just because of something inconvenient dropping into his lap like this. His last one was from yesterday, anyway. He hated when that happened, as it always threw off his perception of time.
He couldn't very well head back downstairs like this. He was under a foot tall now. Toriel would lose her mind with worry.
And yet, no reply from Undyne arrived.

Frisk was still sitting on the edge of his bed, but by now he'd been reduced so greatly in size that he suspected he was no more than a few inches tall.
He thought that the shrinking might have stopped on its own now, at least.
121111.title: On his way down

choices: Toriel rounded the corner, she was coming up!
Frisk's phone went off. Undyne texted back.
1211111.content:
At this point the shrinking had passed the threshold of waiting on a reply from Undyne and Frisk opted on getting immediate aid... regardless of the consequences he figured he'd face. "No way Mom's gonna let me hang out with Alphys or Undyne after this..." Frisk muttered to himself. With a shrug of resignation he started on his trek to the kitchen. Step one... getting down from his bed. He saw his sheets on the right side of the bed were half on the floor. Silently thanking his laziness on making his bed he very carefully shimmied down it to the floor, though at this point he found himself dreading the stairs.

"Well... cross that bridge when I come to it." he muttered to himself. The walk from his room to the stairs took him about 20 minutes. As he took in the sights, Frisk found himself in awe of the common household objects around him; being this small was kinda cool in a way, and it helped him take his mind off of the bad parts of this whole situation. Though if he was being honest with himself, he had half expected Toriel to have come up in that time frame. No such luck though, and soon he was looking down the stairs. Way, way, waaaaaay down he saw his destination. "Okay, time to get determined." Frisk said as he hopped down the first step, which he estimated to be about a 10 foot drop. Landing on his feet he smirked. This wouldn't be so bad! As he prepared to leap down the second step...
1211111.title: Time to get moving

choices: He falls over backwards, and Toriel's foot suddenly looms over him...
He falls forward off the stair, right on top of Toriel's foot.
12111111.content:
That first drop wasn't too bad, so he could probably handle the rest, right?
-BOOM-
Frisk stopped.
-BOOM-
He'd been right near the edge of the second stair when he felt the ground shudder under him.
-BOOM-
"Uh oh."
Frisk had mixed feelings about what we saw at the bottom of the stairs. Toriel had appeared from around the corner leading back into the hall. That figured -- he spent so long waiting for Undyne to respond or for Toriel to come up to his room, and right when he got going for himself, here she was.
The shaking impacts against the floor got more violent as Toriel made her way up the stairs. She had her usual peaceful smile on, and her eyes were drifting about, focused on nothing in particular.
"Mom!!" Frisk shouted, trying to keep his balance. Toriel's next footfall was just a few steps down, now. She was already towering high over his position. "MOM-!!" he shouted again. Toriel seemed not to notice him. Frisk yelped as Toriel's foot came down just one stair below him. The impact finally threw him off balance, and he waved his arms wildly as he fell.
12111111.title: Goatmom inbound

choices: Frisk's phone rings, and he tries to reach it.
The signal drops, and Toriel keeps looking for him.
Something is itching between her toes.
121111111.content:
The ground felt unstable even as Frisk hit the floor, landing on his back. His first thought was to get back up and try one last time to draw Toriel's attention before she passed by him, but he froze in place on the ground instead as a shadow loomed over him half a second later.

-KA-CHUNK-

Light spilled into the endless lab as the door opened. Frisk froze in place, watching as another familiar figure stepped inside. Alphys was home.
The distant crash of the monster scientist's footfalls began to bring her toward him, once she'd closed the door behind her.
"Crap..." Frisk muttered. He'd already skipped on the chance to get Undyne's attention, so would it be better to try and get noticed by Alphys now?
There wasn't a lot of time to decide. Alphys was moving at a fairly respectable pace, and that meant she was closing the enormous distance between Frisk's position and the door very quickly.
Alphys had a new lab coat on. This one was a better fit than the one she'd worn back in the Underground, and didn't drag on the floor quite as much. Still, Frisk thought he might be able to grab on and catch a ride with her, provided he timed it right.

He shouted with exertion, leaping forward as the towering monster scientist passed his position. Throwing out his hands, he grabbed the tightest hold he could on Alphys' lab coat.
Immediately, his grip was put to the test. Alphys' movements were like a rollercoaster, tossing Frisk to and fro in the air. He felt sweat beading up on his forehead, pulling himself up the coat's folds with great effort.
It was going to be a very long climb.

 

"U-Undyne?" Alphys called out, her voice coming out rather quiet. She coughed and cleared her throat. "Undyne? Are you home?" she called out again, more confidently this time.
Listening carefully, she caught the sound of running water. So, her girlfriend was showering at the moment. That meant she had a few minutes to sort away her things before meeting up with her, at least.
Changing direction, Alphys headed for the largest of the several desks she had positioned around the lab. She was carrying a bag, which she hung on the back of her spinning chair.

 

Frisk, meanwhile, was making decent progress in his climb. It hadn't taken him long at all to scale half of Alphys' body, bringing him to the level of her stomach. He was in the shadow of the bag hanging from her shoulder. He had a sudden idea. Alphys was probably going to set her bag down on something, so he could grab onto it if he wanted to take the chance.

Making a split-second call, Frisk moved from Alphys' lab coat and onto her shoulder bag.
Almost instantly, his world rocked aside. Alphys was taking off the bag, like he'd expected.
"Whoa..." he exclaimed, tightening his grip. He swung in the air as Alphys moved the bag toward her desk chair, bringing him along for the ride.
His plan went wrong once Alphys lowered the bag toward the chair. She slung it over the edge of the chair's back, causing it to jerk quite suddenly. Frisk scrambled to hold on, but he lost his grip.
"N-no no no-!!"
Too late. He tumbled through the air, unable to catch himself on anything.

-WHUMP-

"Ugh..."
Clutching at his head, Frisk sat up quickly. He'd made a fairly soft landing, at least. He blinked away his dizziness, looking around.
"... That chair?"
That made sense. It was a pretty short drop. He'd come down on Alphys' chair itself. So, what were his options...?

As it turned out, he had very few. To his considerable alarm, Alphys was apparently planning on sitting down right at this moment. Frisk scrambled to his feet as a shadow overtook him.
High above, Alphys' gigantic form stopped in front of her chair. She shuffled her arms, slipping them out of her lab coat. She took it off, folding it and setting it on the edge of her desk. This left her in plain-looking shorts and a baggy shirt. Frisk looked on in a panic as a colossal backside hovered in the air before him. Alphys was about to sit down right on top of him, and there wasn't any time to move.
"A-Alphys-!!" he shouted desperately, but it didn't save him. The monster scientist dropped toward her chair, he rear coming down like a meteor.

-A story route requested by another user-

"Y-You're sure...?"
"I was sure the last four times you asked, wasn't I?"
Frisk stood alone near the centre of Alphys' lab, gazing up at the large machine stationed there. Alphys herself was positioned at a suitably short control panel several steps away.

Nearly ten years, and Alphys still didn't trust herself completely not to make something go wrong with her experiments.
Frisk wasn't about to say anything that might damage her monster friend's already minimal confidence. She knew better than nearly anyone how easily Alphys could lose the nerve to go through with her work.
Just a few months short of ten years ago, Frisk had finally achieved what she wanted. Even then, at just ten years old, her Determination kept her going through injury, death, and all manner of equally unpleasant experiences to finally free all her newfound monster friends from their former prison underground.
When she thought back now, the world had adjusted surprisingly fast, actually. Considering that the memory of the monsters had faded into the likes of legends, which many people considered nothing more than fiction, the truth about their existence and sudden re-introduction into surface society had gone almost unbelievably well.
Maybe it helped that they'd been led by a smiling young girl who refused to hear so much as a single word against them, no matter what the monsters looked like.

So, to today, Frisk had arrived at Alphys' recently renovated lab for an experiment the two had discussed for quite some time in the past few days.
The machine towering over her was familiar. She'd seen it, shrouded in strange mist, down in the sub-basement labs beneath Alphys' own back in the underground. It didn't look nearly so terrifying now.
Previously, it had been a machine used to extract the substance Alphys called Determination from human SOULs, but by now she'd long since repurposed it.
Frisk reasoned that the memories of what the machine had done in the past were the primary reason for Alphys' current hesitance to use it again.
The plan for this experiment was simple: Alphys would use the machine to identify and measure the precise quantity of the so-called "Determination" that Frisk's SOUL contained, and, with any luck, she would be able to use the data the analysis provided to develop a clearer understanding of the exact properties of Determination and how it might be utilized.

Ever since the day she fell into the Underground all those years ago, Frisk had gained the ability to SAVE and to LOAD. She'd never gone out of her way to talk about this with many of her friends. The monsters she considered family -- Toriel, Asgore, Sans, Papyrus, Undyne, and Alphys herself had been the first to know.
Frisk had seen the end of her adventure in the Underground more times than she could remember. She was never quite satisfied with the bittersweet result she'd achieved until she at last discovered what she was seeking. It nearly cost her her own SOUL, but she managed at last to save not only all the monsters living down below, but also two people she had become nearly obsessed with helping in any way she could: the monster she by now considered her brother, and another human whose SOUL was thought to be long-since lost.
Asriel and Chara Dreemurr were now as close to her as anyone else from the Underground. Naturally, both were also privy to the secret of her Determination.

 

Finished reminiscing, Frisk sighed.
"C'mon, fire it up, Alphys! Don't keep me waiting!"
Alphys muttered uncertainly off on her own, but she started up the machine all the same. Frisk shuddered, hearing the strange, almost ghostly noise the machine emitted.
A rattling wind of exhaust blew forth, ruffling her clothes and hair. Frisk had spent much of her teenage years growing out her brown hair, which she now wore in a messy ponytail.
She faced the machine, ready for anything. Even if something did somehow go wrong, -- though she doubted anything would -- she could easily just LOAD back to whenever she'd last made a SAVE.

"Activating... now!"
Alphys' voice was drowned out by a sound of great energy being expelled. The machine emitted a colourful glow, enveloping Frisk entirely and forcing her eyes shut.

Once the waves receded, Frisk stood upright, opening her eyes.

Another rumble, and then another. Footsteps, by the sound of it. This could be bad.
The sound of a door opening and closing again echoed through the vast space across the floor. Frisk doubted that her sister would have invited anyone over, so it was almost certainly Chara she was hearing entering the room.
Indeed, a moment later, a towering figure appeared in the distance. Chara rounded a corner and stepped into the room.
It was stunning to see her like this. Frisk had seen some incredible things in her life so far, but a human looking to be the size of a small skyscraper was something new for the list.

Chara was dressed rather casually. Her brown hair had been grown out longer in recent years, and it swung gently with her steps.
Frisk stood her ground, watching warily.
1211321312.title: Two humans

choices: Chara talks with her some more.
Chara's in the mood to mess around with her instead.
12113213122.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Frisk was shocked once more. Considering the bizarre nature of her situation, she hadn't expected Chara to recognize her so easily. Really, she was surprised that she'd been spotted at all.
The ground shook more powerfully as Chara approached her, her massive footfalls coming down like collapsing mountains. Frisk felt stunned watching her adoptive sister's movements; she was positively vast, but moving so quickly at the same time...
In no time at all, Chara was stooping toward her diminutive form on the floor.
"Ch-Chara..." she uttered, her voice a bit faint as the young woman's face loomed in over her, looking as large as an entire room. "How'd you see me...?"
"That's pretty easy, little Sis." Chara said plainly, examining her puny body. Frisk waited for her to elaborate, but instead, she just felt the towering girl pinch her body between her finger and thumb, listing her straight off the floor. She wriggled uncomfortably until the dizzying motions stopped. Chara was upright, holding her up to her face. She had a familiar smile, which made Frisk a bit nervous.
12113213122.title: Identified

choices: Yep. Frisk is dropped straight into Chara's open mouth.
Chara's just teasing her for now.
121132131222.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

"Mmm..."
Frisk yelped, suddenly flipping upside-down. Chara had moved her grip to her ankles, leaving the rest of her body to dangle in the air. She frantically waved her arms for something to hold onto, but there was nothing in reach. Her hair swayed in the open air, her ponytail getting even messier than usual.
"Ch-Chara, knock it off-!!" she shouted, trying not to panic.
In response, Chara just wriggled her hand to and fro, causing Frisk to awkwardly swing about in her grip. To her dismay, her shirt ruffled out of place and dropped down to land around her shoulders, covering her face. She could suddenly feel the cool air on the bared skin of her midsection. She heard Chara giggle again. She let out a squeak of discomfort as a large fingertip prodded at her front. Chara's index finger was large enough to jab at her stomach and brush over the underside of her breasts at the same time.

Poor Frisk still didn't really understand what was going on, and Chara seemed to be in no mood to explain.
She thought to just LOAD back to her most recent SAVE and get herself out of this mess, but at the moment, she was a little too preoccupied to focus and manage it.
"Gosh, Frisk, you're even smaller than I thought, now that I look..." Chara teased her, putting on her most irritating voice. "You're so tiny that I might not even notice if something happened to you."
Frisk, still trying to use her arms to do anything that might help herself, hesitated. She didn't like the sound of those words.
"You could just disappear into anything, and I'd probably miss it!" Chara went on. Frisk felt her body being moved again. She tried to crane her neck and look at whatever she was dangling over. Her eyes were still obstructed by her shirt, and she was starting to feel lightheaded from dangling upside-down.
She managed to clamp a hand onto her displaced shirt and tug it away from her face just long enough to spot the thing directly below her. Her eyes widened.
Chara's overlarge face was pointed up at her, her arm holding her right over her head.
Almost as if she'd read Frisk's frightened mind, Chara opened her mouth, revealing a menacing cavern of darkness directly underneath Frisk's position. Was Chara about to eat her...!?
121132131222.title: Fun times

1211321312221.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

The world seemed to shift into slow motion.
The tight grip securing Frisk in the air suddenly vanished, and gravity took an instant hold on the miniaturized young woman. Frisk tried to scream, but her breath just same out in a gasp.
She tumbled straight down the length of Chara's outstretched arm, and within a second, she fell straight into her adoptive sister's cavernous mouth.
"Oof-!"
She struck down on a damp and rough surface that felt like a bad excuse for a water bed. The air was humid, and the light above Frisk's head vanished as Chara closed her mouth.
Frisk tumbled about awkwardly on the huge tongue she'd dropped onto, which wriggled and teased at her tiny body without mercy. She coughed, the air in here unfit for breathing.
Chara's tongue was entirely too strong for her. She struggled, but any movement she made was easily undone as she wrestled pointlessly with the enormous muscle.

Chara was going to eat her? Just like that...?
An echoing giggle gave Frisk her answer. She felt Chara's tongue prodding at her body in the dark for a few seconds more, and then, in a horrible shifting motion, she was tossed helplessly toward the deepest depths of the sweltering cavern.
Scrambling desperately at the slick ground, she felt herself sliding ever backward.
Her efforts couldn't stop the oncoming pull of the muscles working all around her as they claimed her body for themselves.

A horribly uncomfortable journey downward ended when she was deposited into a thick puddle of a rather unpleasantly warm liquid. It didn't take much imagination to guess at where she was.
She struggled out of the sickly mire and found a relatively dry space in the darkness. Curling herself into a ball, she closed her eyes and tried with all her might to concentrate. She needed that SAVE more than ever.
1211321312221.title: Snack Break

121132132.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

"Eugh..."
Frisk shuddered. The scenery didn't make it hard to guess where she was. The why of it was still a total mystery, though.
Muffet was... a friend, Frisk supposed. The spider-girl wasn't really brilliant with social interactions, even years later. She ran a top of the line bakery, but she wasn't particularly popular as a person. It felt a bit mean to say so, but Frisk could only blame that on Muffet's questionable behaviour around others. It seemed like she couldn't hold a conversation without making disconcerting comments about "baking ingredients", which never failed to make people uncomfortable.

The massive room sprawling in all directions was rather sparsely decorated in the way of actual furniture. It might have gone unnoticed to some, on account of the utterly vast quantity of spider webs scattered all around the room.

So, what to do...? Frisk paced around a bit, taking things in. She was on top of a table, by the look of it. Muffet wasn't around, and Frisk was suddenly glad not to see any spiders in the room, either. Muffet's common accompaniment was a bit unpleasant to be around at a normal size. She hated to imagine how the spiders would look now.
121132132.title: Among webs

choices: There's not much she can do for herself.
1211321321.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

She wasn't about to get anything done from here.
Frisk turned on her heel and began to walk across the expanse of the tabletop. She wanted to guess at how many people would likely fit at the table, but given her current size, getting an accurate idea of it was quite impossible.
She couldn't help but notice certain traces on the table to indicate the presence of Muffet and her multitude of spiders. She shuddered again, doing her best not to imagine anything unpleasant.
There was a slightly creased paper on the table with her, not too far away. Frisk headed toward it, more out of curiosity than anything else. On the way over, she tried to remember precisely when she'd last made a SAVE.

The paper looked to be a recipe of some kind. Probably some new baked good that Muffet was experimenting with.
"At least her experiments don't shrink people..."
Frisk was about to continue past the paper when something on it caught her eye. She shuffled over to get a better look at the line of text in question.
Someone had scribbled out a few words and jotted down a note next to them. She felt rather put off by seeing her own name written there in Muffet's familiar scribble.
"Get Frisk!" she read aloud. "... What does she mean by that...?"
On any other day, she could've just asked the spider girl, but today...

There was a sudden click off in the distance. Frisk turned just in time to see a door swing open.
Muffet entered the room, and Frisk felt a bit stunned. The monster was fairly short normally, but like this, she looked impossibly tall, even way off at the other end of the room.
Muffet set aside a jacket and approached the table. Frisk moved aside just in time for the recipe sheet to be picked up from the table. Muffet examined it for a moment. Frisk thought to try and get her attention, but just as she was considering how best to do so, she spotted the massive spider-girl's eyes swivelling to focus on her.
An eerie smile appeared on Muffet's wide face.
"You're just in time!" she said cheerily. Frisk took a nervous step back, but a very large hand was already approaching her.
1211321321.title: Little explorer

12113213211.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

There was something surreal about what Frisk was experiencing. Muffet cheerfully hummed to herself as she carried the diminished human across the room. There was a thicket of webbing attached to the wall over top of a cleared countertop, and Frisk wriggled helplessly as she was raised toward it.
Muffet secured her in place, leaving her body hanging awkwardly in the web, and the spider monster smiled at her.
"Now, you just wait right there, dearie. We'll be ready for your part soon."
"My part...?" Frisk asked, not feeling confident in this at all. She only became more concerned when Muffet didn't reply.
The monster walked back across the room and retrieved several items from a cabinet, taking them up in her several available arms. Judging by the items in question, Frisk could only assume that Muffet was planning on baking something.
Her list of possibilities ran terrifyingly short.
"OK, Frisk, don't lose it..." she muttered to herself, forcing her eyes shut. She'd been in plenty of dangerous situations with monsters in her childhood, so why should this be different? So long as she still possessed her Determination, nothing could kill her for good. And of anyone, Frisk knew what dying was like. She'd been blown up, impaled by magical spears, burned, and met countless other equally unpleasant fates before she learned to survive the Underground.

She flinched. She'd been trying, but she hadn't managed to LOAD back. She tried again, beginning to sweat. This had happened before, as well. If she couldn't focus, she couldn't LOAD without dying first. She might have been used to it, but she still didn't enjoy dying.
"C'mon...!"
...
Nothing.
All Frisk could hear over her own strained breath was Muffet's incessant humming off in the distance.
This wasn't good.

 

Nearly an hour passed before Muffet had finished her project. She opened the small oven at the end of the counter and retrieved a tray of her recognizable spider donuts. She waited for one to cool and picked it up, approaching Frisk's position.
She giggled. "This is where you come in, little Frisk." she said in her disconcertingly singsong voice. A hand rose up and tugged part of the web free of the wall. Frisk remained caught up in it, and Muffet brought her toward the freshly-baked donut. Stringing the web around it, Muffet arranged her little prisoner in place like something of a decoration on the pastry.
Frisk was shaking in fear as she was raised back up to Muffet's face, still immobilized. "Now," began the monster.
12113213211.title: Baking day

121132132112.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Frisk blanched. How in the world was she supposed to respond to that?
... A few ideas came to mind, most of them involving the word 'no' at varying volumes.

The diminished human tugged at her restraints, thrashing until her limbs were sore, but the webbing didn't yield. All the while, Muffet was just watching her with a little smile. The effect of that many eyes fixating on her all at once was incredibly unnerving, especially considering what the monster seemed to be planning to do.
"Oh, you never were very good at wriggling free, were you...?"
Muffet's silky voice only made things worse.
Frisk tried to ignore the dizzying motions she experienced as Muffet began to move again, focusing only on either escaping or successfully making it to her SAVE.
She uttered a noise of strain and shouted. "Help me-!!"
The only voice to answer was Muffet's. The monster giggled infuriatingly. "No, no, silly little Frisk. You're going to help me. I think you're just what this recipe needs."
The motions finally settled as Muffet lowered herself into a chair. She brought the donut and its increasingly desperate passenger up to her mouth.
"I don't think we need a taste test, so, here we go~!"
Frisk screamed, her eyes screwed shut, and a wave of warmth issued over her body. She was inside Muffet's mouth.

A teasing tongue poked at her restrained body, uncomfortably exploring around her. Frisk wanted nothing more than to move for herself and get to anywhere but here, but escape remained quite far out of her reach.

 

Muffet didn't normally play with her food like this, but today's recipe was special. She leaned back in the chair, stifling another giggle at the continued helpless thrashing her tiny friend was carrying on with inside her mouth.
Once she'd had her moment of amusement, she lightly traced a hand over her throat and swallowed, giving a dainty little sigh.

 

Frisk had been through some awful experiences in her less successful trips through the Underground. She was no stranger to pain, but what she was experiencing now was a fresh kind of it.
Monster food worked differently from human food. There was magic involved, of course.
Frisk was not monster food.
She was in total darkness, sickening rumbling noises issuing from the environment around her. She was still restrained, so whatever came her way was going to have the free run of hurting her.
It was all too soon that a burning feeling began to bubble up on her, starting at the legs. She didn't know much about monster biology, so exactly what was happening was a mystery to her. Considering how uncomfortable it was, though, the specifics seemed unimportant.
As moments wore on, she hoped more and more that the webs restraining her might tear away, but long before anything of the sort happened, the burning feeling was creeping up her body. Soon, it seemed to be everywhere. The discomfort became so great that Frisk couldn't properly coordinate her movements to try and escape any more, leaving her to simply writhe in place.
She expected her SOUL to split apart at any moment. Honestly, she wanted it to, at this point.
In her mind, an image of Muffet giggling away outside of this hell flashed through the darkness.
It almost seemed to freeze as a sudden rippling jolt split through Frisk's body. It was a feeling she hadn't experienced in a long time, yet it felt familiar as anything instantly.

She faintly heard an unearthly noise that echoed all through her mind. This, too, was instantly recognizable, despite the years since she'd last heard it.
In the darkness, a luminescent red heart split down the middle and shattered.

Frisk was done, just done with everything, sure he was an orphan, sure he was two inches tall there were others like him such as Morgan who had a bazillion gorgeous female relatives and Ren who was adopted by their smoking hot Russian Science teacher, but for whatever reason (now that Frisk thought about he knew what it was) he was the one always picked on, Frisk was quiet and pretty nerdy, so was Ren and Morgan yet they never got picked on.

Frisk fell, opened his eyes seeing yellow flowers, rather falling on them he falls into a crevice on the side of the wall, he was forced to curl up as due to gravity, science and all that stuff he rolled (sort of like in those wiggly tubes in sonic games).

It felt like forever until he was deposited and fell onto a blue flower.

Frisk opened his eyes seeing he was in some sort of cave with fourteen glowing blue flower around him, he touched on to help support him in his dizzy state

Frisk tried to speak at what the plant said but felt that it would be a bad idea.

121133222112.title: Echo flowers

choices: Toreil wants to keep him all to herself, at least for now
She wants to show him off to the other monster gals
12113322212.content:
Frisk's landing didn't quite reach the afterlife, instead it reached something more soft and ... squishy?

'Oh my, what do we have here?' a female voice wondered aloud, perking Frisk up significantly. Tilting his head to a position where he could see something other than black/purple his eyes nearly blew out of their sockets when he saw what he'd landed on; a being that resembled an anthropomorphic goat (at least based on the facial features and the little horns), of which her quite sizable rack was his landing site/airbag

'Um, hi?' Frisk meeps, despite his age he still blushed as he tried look anywhere but the lady's face or breasts

'Oh you can speak, do you have a name?' the goat lady asks with a sweet voice

'Um Frisk Maam' he answers timidly

'Well hello Frisk, I'm Toriel and it was really lucky I was picking berries when I did or else you'd have gone splat' she giggles slightly and it shook his landscape

'Um thanks Miss, I guess I should be going' Frisk replies, not wanting to impose, nor did he want to make the nice lady mad by sticking around for too long. As he pushed himself to a standing position Toriel's fingers wrap around him

'Wait. Um, I mean you don't have to go, plus it's so lonely in this place all alone, by myself, with nobody around to keep me company' the demon bemoans and Frisk wonders if she's implying what he thinks she is

'Um, I could stay if you like'

'That would be great, it's been a long time since I had anyone special around' she smiles and Frisk's heart flutters

'Can we be a family?' he asks before his happiness can wane

Toriel's smile nearly splits her face 'Of course little one, momma Tori's here to love you' she nuzzles the little boy against her furry face, the soft hairs feeling nice against the human's skin and he leans in to cuddle

So, what now?

choices: Interact with only Your Best Friend. (Asriel.)
Interact with others. (feel free to add most monsters from the underground!)

12121.title: Female Chara

choices: He thinks you and him should keep talking.
121211.content:
You wake up. You feel dizzy, but otherwise fine. When the feeling of Dizziness goes away, you stand up and look around. Hold on a second. Something is wrong here. You look around and realise that everything around you has grown huge! Or maybe You're just really small. Either way, you're gonna need help. Luckily, you have a best friend and you're in his room!

Suddenly, you hear a loud stomping. The ground is shaking. But You know It's just Azzy. He comes in and says in his cute little voice, "Chaaaaraaaaa? Are you hiding in here?" you scream your head off, but it's to no use. You're just too small. Luckily, he is standing about your height away from you (probably about an inch.) You run to his foot and start pounding it. He seems Unfazed at first, but then he looks down at his foot. "Hey, is that a little bug?" He bends over to get a closer look. After a moment of inspection, He recognizes his Best Friend and (kind of) Sister.

He almost stumbles back but realises that would fling you off of his foot. Instead, he picks you up very slowly and carefully. "C-Chara? Is that really you?" he asks with a trembling voice. You respond with a "Azzy! It is me! I'm just as confused as you!", but he can't hear you. He lifts up his floppy, fluffy ear and puts you close to it. You repeat yourself, this time at an inside voice. He says, "Chara, how did this happen to you? Are you okay?" You and him talk back and forth, both relieved to have each other there. You look at the clock, Yawn, and tell Azzy that you and him should get some rest.
121211.title: Hey, Azzy!

1212111.content:
You toss and turn but you just can't sleep.
It's not the bed, it's you. Asriel has been cautious enough to make sure he stays on the other side of your bed, so he doesn't accidentally harm you. So you have all of this space to yourself yet you still can't sleep.
Sighing, you gently begin to lower yourself. Grabbing onto the bedsheets, you slide your way to the floor. You decide that you need something else to do. You make your way to the door, leading to the main hallway of the house, and easily slip under it. The house is pitch black, which makes sense considering it's still midnight.

To the right is your parents, Asgore and Toriel, room. Maybe you should pay them a visit. You and Asriel never told them that you had shrunken. It's not that you were hiding that fact, it's just that you were so busy talking that it never crossed your mind.

To the left is the bathroom, there's nothing interesting about it but someone seemed taking a shower. The sound of rushing water can be heard and light is leaking out from underneath the door. Interesting, you think to yourself, could be worth checking out.
1212111.title: Nighttime is the right time

12121112.content:
Why would someone be taking a shower at this time of night?
This question stayed in your mind as you inched towards the bathroom door. All you wanted to was see who was un the bathroom and then leave. At least, that's what you told yourself. But as you reached the wooden door, your curiosity had piqued.

Taking a deep breath beforehand, you slide underneath the door and stand on the tiled bathroom floor. Oddly, the bathtub faucet is flowing, but you don't see anyone in the room.

Then, a loud rumbling alerts you of someone's presence. A white furred foot crashes down from above you. Then another foot comes down and you find yourself in between them. You quickly scurry out from underneath the large shadow and run towards the giant bathtub until you slip on some soapy water.

Looking up at the owner of the two feet, you see ___ wearing nothing but a towel to cover their body.
12121112.title: Showering with family?

121212.content:
So Chara has been shrunken.
Was it a random accident? Or was it deliberate on the part of one of the other monsters?
Decide her fate here...

Who does Chara interact with first?
121212.title: Tiny Chara

choices: Frisk wakes up and sees Chara crying on the floor.
Chara pulls herself together and goes for help.
Chara can't help it, and rushes to Frisk for help. (Charisk Story)
1212122.content:
"Oh God... what happened? Where am I...?" Chara looked around, realizing they were on the floor of their house. Less comfortably, everything around them was now huge. "Am I tiny...? How did this happen? ... I'm gonna need some help."

Chara heard some stirring noises behind her; she turned around to see Frisk also lying on the floor. They, however, were normally-sized making them a giantess to the tiny Chara. "I need help, but not from you, partner..."

 

Chara and Frisk had a great relationship now, but it was rocky at the start. The human that woke her up from her slumber, and then after a failed pacifist run, took it out on everyone around her in a genocide run. Eventually after selling their soul to fix the world, they completed a true pacifist run and led everyone to the surface.

Unfortunately Chara had been corrupted by Frisk's actions. On the surface, Chara took control of her partner's body, and made life hard for those around her. No one could understand why Frisk would hate other humans for what they did to monsters, until one day Chara slipped up and said something only Chara herself would know.

Chara had become saddened inside; she wasn't angry at Frisk or the other humans anymore. She had her family right there in front of her, but to them she was Frisk, someone Chara watched kill them. She broke down one day and lashed out at everyone, about how she was replaced by a real monster.

Toriel was the first to recognize Chara's words coming from Frisk's mouth. So she hugged her long lost child, and soothed them. Toriel had hugged them before obviously, but it was Frisk getting the affection. That hug wasn't meant for Frisk, it was for her. She was no longer invisible in her mother's eye. She cried and let everything out that day.

Frisk who had been silent for weeks, watching Chara use her body to bring pain to others, finally broke that silence with an apology. Frisk apologized for everything they did to Chara's family, her home, and monster kind. But also for what their actions had turned Chara into. She promised she would do better, and never hurt anyone else again. Chara broke that day, the love and attention from her mother, and Frisk's apology and admittance of guilt, caused her anger and hate towards others to waver.

She let go of Frisk's body that day. She instead chose to live in a trash bin in Frisk's room, because that's what she felt like. Not that anyone other than Frisk could see her sitting in there all day. Frisk never gave up on Chara. She reset the timeline to a point before Chara had broke down in front of everyone, and called herself a demon in Frisk's body. Chara wasn't a demon, and no one needed to remember her as one.

Frisk worked tirelessly with Alphys to find how one could restore a lost soul. After weeks studying what a soul was, how one could restore one, and what would happen if attempted. It ultimately came down to Frisk splitting their own soul to give half to Chara. After finally convincing Chara to give it a try, they used their now-shared determination to load a save point, and both of them had appeared at the save point that day, in their respective bodies.

Things were still a little rocky even after that. Chara mostly hung out alone away from others, even her parents at times, too ashamed of what they had done. It also didn't help that Sans could remember the timeline where Chara was controlling Frisk and causing trouble for everyone. Even though Frisk numerous times said it was their own fault, and that Chara wasn't to blame for the things that happened. Sans and others that had somehow picked up on Sans' distrust of Chara, were never that open to her.

The damage was done. The true monster had set themselves up as the savior, while the victim was demonized. Very few could see the real truth, and this only haunted Chara more. This eventually all went away though. Time heals all wounds and now they were all living together happily. Even Sans saw the error of his ways and tried his best to try to make things up to Chara. After years of research Alphys even found a way to restore Flowey back into Asriel.

Now Chara, Frisk, and Asriel lived together after becoming to old too live with their mom. Things were great. "So why is all this coming back to me now?" Chara said to herself, crying with all these sad memories racing in her head.
1212122.title: The Real Monster.

choices: Frisk wakes up, while Chara's still asleep.
Frisk waking up, wakes Chara as well.
Asriel enters the living room to find the sleeping Frisk, unaware of Chara.
12121223.content:
First off, since this is more or less leading to Chara and Frisk in some level of a relationship, both of them are 18+. Same goes for Asriel since he's supposed to be around the same age as Chara anyway. Now to continue.

Chara ran across the floor to her sleeping partner. This took a while as the living room was now huge, and running on carpet at her size was not the easiest task. She finally reached Frisk and let herself fall into their body. It was warm and the sweater Frisk wore made it cozy. Chara was feeling better already. She stepped back a minute to see what she had ran face first into.

"Oh, crap... this is embarrassing." Chara said out loud as she realized she had hugged Frisk's boob. "They cannot find out about this." she said quietly to herself. "Now how to get their attention?" Chara pondered.

"... I'm going to have to climb it, aren't I?" Chara said to herself looking at Frisk's chest. The goal of course was to get to Frisk's ear to gently wake them up, as banging on their face seemed like a bad way to wake up a giant. With Frisk lying on the side of their face, one ear was clearly unavailable while the other would only be reachable if she climbed on top of her partner. And Frisk's chest was the only safely climbable surface she could see.

Chara sighed. "It's just a pair of breasts. All girls have them; Frisk, mom, myself. Just another part of the female body." Chara said to herself, trying to keep from thinking that the surface she was scaling was her partner's boobs. She finally reached the top of Frisk's breast, and spent a moment catching her breath. "Alright... let's start moving towards your head, partner." Chara said out loud.

After just a few steps, however, everything started to shake. "No, no, no -- don't you dare turn over right now." Chara yelled. Frisk did turn over, however. Luckily for Chara it was onto her back, and she had managed hold on to Frisk's sweater. "Thank goodness." Chara said and breathed a sigh of relief.

It was too early to celebrate, however, Chara realized, as Frisk was turning over yet again. This time though, Chara had fallen to the floor and only had time to look up at Frisk's chest about to crush her.

-smash-

Chara opened her eyes, and soon realized she was stuck. Frisk's giant boob and all its weight was on top of her. "Dammit, Frisk...! Your stupid boobs are smothering me! Wake up already!" All this yelling was to no avail however, as her voice wasn't loud enough to wake her sleeping partner.

Chara stewed for a minute, but then just sighed. "It's not the worst predicament, I guess. At this size there's plenty of worse situations I could be in right now. I'll just wait for Frisk to get up, then get her help fixing whatever happened to me."

Chara felt herself relaxing. It was actually somewhat comfortable under Frisk's breasts; like being buried under giant pillows. And Frisk's gentle and steady breathing was enough to fall asleep to. With a final yawn, Chara had fallen asleep, trapped under her partner's breasts.
12121223.title: Climbing Frisk.

121212231.content:
An hour later, Frisk slowly began to stir from her peaceful sleep. As she opened her eyes, she looked to where Chara had been resting with her hours earlier. To her surprise, Chara wasn't there. Frisk sat up and rubbed her eyes, trying to see where Chara might have wandered off to. Maybe she just went to the bathroom, or went to go get... Frisk thought, before false realization hit her. She quickly got up and ran towards the kitchen, yelling "Chara, you better not be eating the chocolate in the fridge again!"

As Frisk entered the kitchen, she saw Chara wasn't there. She checked the fridge, and sure enough none of the chocolate was missing. Frisk looked around, as if some sign was going to point to where Chara was. Sure enough, one did when a quiet snore rang from the living room.

Frisk followed the sound and looked all around, expecting to find a full sized Chara curled up in a corner. Instead, the source of the sound was a miniature version of her partner, curled up and snoring where Frisk was just laying. She knelt down and inspected the tiny woman. This is unreal. How...how could she shrink like this, and...WHAT WAS SHE DOING THERE OF ALL PLACES?!? she thought, freaking out at both realizations.

She knew she couldn't just leave Chara laying there, so she carefully cupped Chara in her hands and carried her to their bedroom. While Asriel had his own room, Chara and Frisk shared a room, a bed on either side for the two of them. As Frisk headed towards Chara's bed, she started to slowly wake up, Frisk's movements feeling like earthquakes to the tiny girl.

Chara opened her eyes and looked around frantically as the ground beneath her continued to shake. She tried to stand up, causing Frisk to jerk in surprise. From the sudden stop, Chara fell out of Frisk's hands and flew across the room, luckily landing safely on her bed. As she righted herself, she shot her head up to Frisk, glaring in frustration. "Ugh, first you lay on top of me and then you toss me onto my bed?! I thought you would help me!" she yelled, tears beginning to roll down her face.

Frisk bent down and looked concerningly at Chara, tears starting to swell in her eyes as well. "Chara, I-I... I'm sorry. I only found you after waking up and looking for you, and you did scare me just now." She took a deep breath, trying to process all of this. "Let's get some things straight first. How did you shrink down?"

Chara looked back to Frisk, tears still steaming down her eyes. "I don't know! I woke up like this and tried to get your attention, but instead you rolled over me and smooshed me under your-" she screamed, stopping suddenly. They looked at each other, both blushing in embarrassment. Chara turned away and continued. "Like I said, I don't know how I ended up like this. As much as I hate to admit it, I...I...I need your help partner!" Chara turned away and fell into her bed, her emotions taking full control of her.

Frisk sat for a moment, watching as her friend broke down in front of her. Gently, she rubbed Chara's back with a single finger, humming quietly. The tiny woman looked up at Frisk, sobbing quietly. Chara pushed Frisk's finger and giggled a bit. "For a person who's had their soul possessed by the very person in front of them, you sure do care about me, don't you? Now, what to do about...this?"

Frisk looked up a bit, pondering Chara's question. "Well...we could go try going to Alphys. She is the one who restored your body after all." Chara frowned, shaking her head. "Frisk, you do remember Alphys and Undyne went on that trip to...what did they call it? Comic con or whatever it's called? Either way, they won't be back for at least a few days." Frisk sighed. "Well...let's at least try calling her. That wouldn't hurt, would it?" Chara huffed to herself. "I...guess not. Just...figure this out, so I can be myself again. You don't know how..." she said, her words trailing off with a sigh. Frisk sighed as well, guessing what Chara was about to say.

She grabbed her phone and dialed Alphys' number. One ring. Two rings. Three rings. "H-Hi, this is Alphys, royal scientist of A-Asgore Dreemurr. Please leave a message and I-I'll to get back to you." Frisk left a message explaining what had happened and shut her phone off. She looked back to Chara, who was thoroughly annoyed.

"Of course she's not answering! She's probably at that Mew Mew Kissy thing! Now what do I do?! I can't stay like this!" Chara paced the bed, pulling at her hair in frustration. As Frisk tried to console her again, Chara lashed back, slapping her hand away. "You don't understand what this is like Frisk! I-"

Frisk interrupted. "You feel vulnerable and scared, right?" Chara looked up to Frisk, shocked. "H-How..." she stammered. "Well, you did just shrink for no reason and are powerless to do anything about it. Plus, after you got stuck under my....you know, I'm sure you're worried something like that might happen again." She paused, looking Chara right in the eyes. "Chara, I know you're scared, but there's nothing we can do about it right now. For now, can you trust me? Me and Asriel are here for you." Frisk held out both of her hands.

Chara looked at her partner, her mind at a complete standstill. Frisk... I want to trust you, but... is what she wanted to say. She felt just like those monsters all those years ago, trapped underground. Their lives were at the mercy of a single child, that child standing right in front of her. Before, she would have easily trusted Frisk, but between the events that just occurred and her memories coming back to her, she felt very uneasy around her.

Then, a single memory took her attention. It was the same memory from before: Frisk promising not to hurt anyone. Chara looked at her hands, as she did during that memory. She could see Frisk's hands, holding hers gently. Then another memory took her attention, the memory of both of them resetting, hands held much in the same way.

She looked at Frisk's hands right now, in that very position once again. Chara looked at her own, much smaller than the ones in front of her. She sighed and approached Frisk's hands, sitting down on her knees and placing her hands on them. "I'll try. Thank you...Frisk."

She stood up again and gently stepped onto Frisk's hands, motioning for her to bring her up. Frisk smiled and obliged, bringing Chara up to her face. Chara stepped forward and gave a small kiss and hug to the giant's cheek, much to Frisk's surprise. Her face went bright red as Chara looked back at her, a smirk on her face. "Oh, is someone a bit shy to affection? I guess we'll have to fix that later. For now, how about we relax a little and make some food while we wait for Asriel?"

Frisked nodded in agreement, placing Chara on her shoulder and heading to the kitchen.


So reader, it's time to decide. Would you like to see Chara and Frisk enjoying themselves a little before Asriel gets home or would you rather read someone's spin off of this, jumping to another timeline?

1212123.title: Asgore or Others

choices: King Dad! (Asgore, but before Chara's death)
Asgore as he's seen in the game.
12121231.content:
As consciousness flooded back to Chara, the first thing she noticed was her pounding head, her aching body and the expansive yellow landscape beneath her. She let out a small whine as she stood up, the girl wincing as she clambered to her feet. Her knees shook as the ground beneath her did too. Soon enough, her pounding headache began to clear, allowing her to properly perceive what was around her.

The human child's eyes widened nervously as she noticed what she was stood upon. It was a golden flower. Similar golden flowers extended out around her ages, and an enormous seat stood in the distance. Recollection flashed in Chara's eyes as she remembered what that was, it was dad's throne, the one her and Asriel would sit on together. The seat was always big, but this most definitely wasn't right. She was two inches tall.

Biting her lip, Chara shuffled forwards, freezing as the flower she was on tipped a little. The now tiny human leaped off of the flower, and onto another, this time a little closer to the ginormous throne. She continued to jump from flower to flower, travelling a reasonable distance towards the towering chair. The girl froze as she heard a faint rumble, her hands clasping together as her head flicked around.

Her eyes went wide as she turned around, seeing the shape of someone, a giant someone, filling the door. It was _________.
12121231.title: Asgore

choices: Asgore feels something tugging at his cloak, and checks what it is.
He continues his search for Chara, unaware of where she actually is.
121212311.content:
As the simply enormous shape entered the throne room, Chara tried to move, but she found herself unable to. It was Asgore, her father, the king, now a towering figure. He always was tall, even more than her mother, but this was to a degree she just didn't expect.

"Chara?" He called, "Where have you ran off to dear?" His voice was deep and booming, as if he really was a giant, "Tori's made pie, come and have some,"

The human child called out to him, "Dad!" She cried, "Down here! On the flowers!" But alas, her voice came out too quiet, and he was just too far up. The king walked slowly through the room, continuing to call for her. Chara's eyes widened as a large white foot landed next to her, the girl squeaking as she scrambled back from it, onto the next flower along.

She noticed his cloak trailing on after him, and had an idea. She tracked it with her gaze,watching as it swept past the golden flowers nearby, their seeds sticking to it's bottom. Sensing her opportunity, the first child leapt off of the flower, falling onto the soft purple fabric among the seeds. She clutched some of the cloak up in her hands, holding on as tight as she could.
121212311.title: King Dad! (Asgore, but before Chara's death)

1212123111.content:
Chara tensed as the movements of the cloak suddenly halted, the tiny human gazing up. Asgore had felt something, a small something, tug against his cloak. Whilst it could just be a flower caught under it, it was always worth investigating, there were a few instances of tiny froggits getting lost, and what kind of king would he be to not help them.

He turned his head, gazing down at the purple cloak, a fond smile spread across his face at the yellow seeds on the bottom of the cloak. His eyes searched for any hint of white that would indicate a miniature froggit, but instead, another hue met his eyes, green.

Slowly, he strolled over to his throne, clutching the side of the cloak in hand. He definitely didn't know of any green monsters of that scale, and his curiosity had been piqued.

Chara watched helplessly as he looked down at his cloak, then turned away, beginning to walk again. Her hands tightened around the cloak, she'd just need to stay determined, hopefully her dad would find her soon.

Slowly lifting the cloak up, he sat upon the throne, resting it on his lap as he observed the small thing closely. His eyes widened as he saw the pale limbs, the stripes on the green shirt, the neat-ish mop of brown hair. Chara. How had she gotten like that?

"Chara," He spoke, more quietly, he knew that the tiny froggits would ask for him to quieten down, as he was too loud for them, and figured that the same would hold true for his daughter, "Are you alright dear?"

Ever so slowly, he pinched the back of her shirt between two of his fluffy white fingers, lifting the human child into his palm. The tiny human let out a small yelp as she was lifted up, her limbs flailing a little as she was quickly lowered onto a soft, soft surface.
"D-Dad," She spoke quietly, her previous confidence having vanished. She gazed into his eyes, watching as they softened sympathetically, "W-What's happening to me?"

"I'm not sure dear, but we'll get to the bottom of it," He spoke, his voice as soft as his fur was. Chara felt something run down her back, her muscles tensing, "Oh, sorry Chara, you just have some seeds on your back," He smiled awkwardly, the few seeds getting stuck to his finger.

"Anyway, Tori has pie, would you like to go and eat?" He asked, looking down at her with soft, sympathetic eyes. The human girl peered up at him.
1212123111.title: Asgore feels something tugging at his cloak.
