12121232.title: Trashbag!

12121233.content:
What is this? ...Where am I? How? How can I...feel this? Am I...Am I back? Am I...Alive?!

Chara opened her red eyes in utter surprise. She couldn't believe it; she'd opened her eyes in the first time in years. She saw a glowing white plan out before her as she sat on a cold floor. The light almost blinded her and she actually squinted from the pain in her eyes. She couldn't believe it. She could feel that.
Mustering her strength she was able to move her arms and slowly sat up; she had control over her body again. She had her body again! She sat up and looked around as she adjusted to the light.

What is this place? she thought to herself. Is this the Core? Is this...no...I wouldn't be alive if it was. But then why?

Chara then began to notice the circular shape of the chamber she was in. The walls were made of glass and she began to notice the odd landscape beyond it. Things were starting to come together in a rather bizarre fashion. But soon as Chara turned around in her tiny chamber she soon came across a rather large tan-colored wall beyond the glass and two squinting eyes staring at her. Chara sighed and rolled her eyes seeing it; more annoyed than scared.

"Oh," she said sounding rather bored. "It's gonna be one of...those kind of days."

--

Frisk was staring into the glass bottle that was sitting on Alphys' work station; the white lights made it seem like the glass was glowing. She watched as the tiny creature inside the body slowly began to stir; the others were busy talking about what they were going to do when she woke up, but Frisk never took her eyes off of Chara; the first fallen child, and the original Human of the Dreemurr family. Frisk always felt that Chara was her last bit of unfinished business...the last person to save...

"What are you doing my child?" Toriel asked as she approached her. Frisk turned around but before she could say anything, Toriel noticed that Chara had begun to move. "Oh my; everyone come quick, she's awake at last."

--

Chara threw her hands over her ears after the large Goat boss monster came up to Frisk and noticed her moving. Her voice was so loud and it was grating. She slowly glared up at the giant Toriel and soon other figures began to join her and Frisk, surrounding the bottle.

"What is going on?!" Chara asked.

"Now-now Chara; stay calm," Asgore said looking down at his shrunken adoptive daughter. "Frisk here told us everything."

"About how even in death, you were so angry that you were willing to kill everyone of us and you tried to make Frisk help you do it," Toriel said. "I'm rather disappointed in you, Chara."

"Hey, I'm not all to blame," Chara said grinning wickedly and shrugging her shoulders. "After all," she then turned her narrow red eyes toward Frisk. "I needed a good partner to get the job done."

Frisk frowned and cringed remembering all of the things they did together. Suddenly Chara found her world rocking back and forth when Sans reached over and flicked the bottle she was being kept in.
"Oops, how clumsy of me," Sans said.

Once Chara had got settled again she glared back at Sans. "You better watch-it, Trashbag!"

"I guess that's fair," Sans said shrugging. "After all, I am a Bag of Bones!"

"Good lord Sans, Stop it!" Papyrus said.

"It's a good thing that Frisk has the power to reset the timeline," Chara heard a voice say. She turned and saw Asriel standing above her. She couldn't believe it.

"Azzy?" she asked in disbelief. "How are you not a flower?!"

"Uh, I can explain that," Alphys said coming up. "When Frisk told us the truth about Flowey, I ran some experiments using Determination. I found a way to restore him back to his original form."

"And that's when Frisk told us about you, Chara," Toriel said. "Asriel confirmed her story."

"So using the same research I did to bring back Asriel, I was able to bring you back to life and gave you a body of your own again," Alphys continued. "But uh...as you can see...when it came to regenerating your form, your parents had an interesting idea to keep you from...well being so homicidal..."

"So that's why I'm shrunken, eh?" Chara asked, becoming angrier. "You think you can control me by keeping me small?!"

"Now Chara, don't take that tone with us," Toriel said again.

"So Frisk told you about everything we did huh? You seem to have forgiven her; but what about me huh? What did you bring me back for; a scapegoat so that Frisk can be blameless? To get your revenge on me? You're all cowards you know that? Shrinking me down so that you don't have to fight me on fair terms?"

"Now Chara; no one here is going to fight you, or is after revenge," Asgore said.

"Speak for yourself, Asgore," Undyne said. "I hear that this little Punk has a lot to answer for."

"Undyne, please," Toriel began. "Chara, this isn't about punishing you for your past sins; although we are holding you accountable for them. This is more about...rehabilitation."

"...What does that mean?" Chara asked, now glaring daggers at Toriel.

"It means I want my sister back," Asriel said. "I want things to go back to the way they were, Chara; before you died...I want us to be friends again."

"...Friends?" Chara asked now smiling wickedly. "I thought I was the enemy here...Isn't that right...Undyne?" The fish-woman glared at Chara as she pried at her. "Human beings are the Enemy aren't they?" Chara continued. "Or how about you, 'Dad'? Isn't every single human who falls down here put to death?"

"That's quite enough of that, Chara," Asgore said, trying to hold his temper.

"You want to hold me accountable for my crimes; what about theirs? Between the two of them, how many humans did they kill? I think there was six." Chara was trying to start discourse among them. She slowly turned around to look at Sans. "Or how about you, Comedian? How many humans did you kill before you made that little promise? And do I need to bring up -" Chara began to turn around and look at Frisk. "How many times you killed us in retaliation for your brother? I think even you lost count...And of course, lets not forget Saint Frisk, the Pacifist Human who freed the Underground, and my Partner in Genocide, shall we?"

"That's enough, Chara!" Frisk said. "I've put that behind me...And right now, I do think you're right; you do need to be punished for everything that you've done. But everything that you are...I think that's punishment enough. This isn't about that...I told them to bring you back because I want to save you, Chara."

"Save me...how cute," Chara said. "And yet, you felt the need to handicap me; make me into some kind of toy or pet; make me powerless, didn't you?"

"What can we say, Kid? You can kill Boss-Monsters in a single blow; we're not taking any chances," Sans said.

"You don't have to be so hostile, my child," Toriel said. "Everything that we're doing here, is for your own good. So during the course of your rehabilitation, each one of us will be responsible for you throughout the day. And hopefully during these extended interactions with everyone in our...family, you'll get to know everyone a bit more; see their redeeming qualities. And maybe you'll learn to stop being so angry."

"So you did bring me back to be the family pet," Chara said. "Well forget it; I'm not going to roll-over and fetch for you people; no matter how long you make me spend time with these lowlifes."

"You should mind your attitude, Missy," Toriel said. "Because until you learn to behave yourself, you can expect to be at that size for the foreseeable future. So you might as well do your part in this rehabilitation."

"I'd also like to point out that, this is your last chance, kid," Sans said. "Because without Frisk's determination, you can't come back if you get hurt. So if I were you, I wouldn't be such a wise-ass."

"We'll see about that, Trashbag," Chara grinned at Sans rather menacingly.

"Oh yeah; I can already tell this is going to be loads of fun," Undyne said as she face-palmed.

"Well I for one am excited about this," Papyrus said. "If Frisk could become best-buddies with the Coolest Guy around - that's me - I'm certain that the...uh...Smaller Human could do it. We can go jogging! Undyne and I can teach her how to cook! And I can show her all my cool puzzles!"

"First chance I get, I am jumping off a high counter," Chara said leaning on one arm. "Really starting to miss my knife."

Frisk saw Chara's less than enthusiastic attitude and winced. "Chara, please...I know this is going to work; if you're any kind of good like I hope you are, then you'll see everything that I see. Just give us a chance..."

"Well said, Frisk," Asgore said. "Now that introductions are over, who wants to take the first shift with our little Hell-Raiser here?"
12121233.title: Evil Little Human

First on her list was her Partner well EX-Partner Frisk.Frisk seemed to be the easiest to deal with out of the three She was fa to nice and naive for her own good ant that was perfect for Chara She believed she could find a way to trick frisk in to thinking she was nicer and that that would probably at least free her from the stupid bottle she was trapped in. 1213311112.content:
You scream and shout and flail your arms with all your might, but unfortunately the young girl in the stripped shirt keeps walking towards you, her gigantic boot raised above your head you notice many squashed bugs stuck to her boot sole, her leather boot sole comes down on top of you pressing you to the floor, you begin to cry as you realize any hope of surviving this was gonna, you were going to die here, you could feel your bones beginning to crack, you scream in agony as your flesh begins to tear and your guts begin to spill out

CRUNCH*

It was all over, you were now a lifeless smear stuck to the young girl's boot, your gruesome death is very tragic, after all frisk is a very nice young girl, if you had only got her attention she probably would have taken care of you, but none of that matters now

1213311112.title: Beneath determination's boot

121331112.content: If you didn't notice, there are quite a few monsters in Undertale. This is gonna be a choice chapter.
121331112.title: A monster

12133112.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Today was a fairly normal day, all things concerned.
... It was funny to think about how different that sentence's meaning was now. Just a few years ago, monsters definitely wouldn't have been called "normal".
They were now, though. The world was coming up on seven years since the population of bizarre and eccentric creatures from deep underground -- that only the most paranoid conspiracy theorists of the world had actually believed to exist -- had emerged from their long imprisonment, led by a single human kid in a striped shirt.
That was quite the day.
You'd met some monsters over time. There were certainly a lot of them, and it was hard to believe that anyone could possibly get to know every last one of them. Aside from the kid who freed them, at least. They seemed to be a friend to the entire monster population.
So, the human race shared their world with monsters again. Some history books needed to be scrapped and rewritten, but seven years gave the world enough time to adjust.

 

At the moment, you were enjoying a walk near the outskirts of your home city. There was a festival going on in the downtown area, celebrating the day that the monsters first left the Underground. You'd been through the crowded streets, having a good time and enjoying the odd bit of monster food here and there, -- that stuff was incredible, actually -- and felt like slipping away for a break. You could still hear the music and a rumble of voices from here.

Passing by a small park, something caught your eye. A few people were grouped up in the park's footpath. Some monsters you didn't recognize, and a couple of humans.
They were showing off some magic, by the look of it. One of the humans dodged a colourful blast launched by one of their monster friends, laughing as they went. They darted around behind the other monsters, and you spotted a glow of energy swelling up from beyond their position.
You reacted a split-second too late, unfortunately. The human dodged again, and the next blast fired straight past them, screaming through the air toward you, instead.
It struck you squarely in the stomach, and you flinched, but after a second or two, you still couldn't feel any pain or anything else. You looked yourself over. Everything seemed fine, actually. You weren't sure if the group even noticed.
So, the magic wasn't dangerous, then. That was good. You brushed yourself off, just in case, and turned to keep going. Maybe you'd head back to the party.

You only got about three steps before something went wrong. A bright glow, like the one the monster who fired the blast had generated, suddenly appeared right at the spot where the blast had passed through you. You jerked in place, looking around in alarm.
The light expanded until you were blinded, and when your vision cleared up...
It seemed like that shot of magic wasn't quite as harmless as you thought.
You recognized that you were still standing on the same stretch of footpath, but the area looked... bigger. Like, a lot bigger.
You'd shrunk. You remembered seeing a monster perform tricks involving shrinking magic before. You'd even thought briefly about what it would be like to have it used on you, but...
Well, the reality was at least as scary as you'd imagined. You staggered back, slipping on the gap between two of the footpath's flat stones and falling over.
Still on the ground, you heard a rumble. Someone was approaching.
12133112.title: After the Underground

choices: It's a girl, with brown hair and a green striped hoodie. She's somehow familiar.
A boy; brown hair, green striped hoodie. He's almost familiar.
121331121.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

"Oh, jeez..."
The pounding of footsteps came closer. The figure producing them loomed high over you. They were human, at least. You could tell that right away. Craning your neck up, you got a good look up at them.
121331121.title: Found by a human

choices: "I just want to play with you, first." Chara says.
"You just need to do me a few favours, first." she says.
1213311211.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Your breath snagged in your throat. This girl was enormous, and that meant you were utterly puny. She wasn't going to step on you, was she?
She wore neatly-kept boots. The left one pounded down not far from your position, and the towering girl halted. Breathless, you watched as she glanced downward.
"Oh, there you are." she said. You didn't like the sound of that.
The girl, as tall as a city building, stooped down toward you. You nervously got to your feet. She was very pretty, looking like she was somewhere from the very end of her teens to her early twenties. Her brown hair looked soft, and it framed a face with very distinctively attention-grabbing eyes. Still, you somehow felt a bit alarmed by her presence. Mostly the comment she'd made. She looked right at you, her lips splitting into a little smile.
"Greetings." she said softly. Her voice was a gentle kind of trill. "I saw what happened to you back there. I don't think those guys even noticed, so you're lucky I was passing by."
"Uhh..." you tried to reply. Your throat felt dry. "Y-Yeah." you managed.
"My name's Chara." she said, tilting her head aside a bit. "Why don't you come up here with me?"
"Sure," you said, glad for the chance to be off the ground. "And my name's-"
Your voice was cut off as the girl -- Chara, apparently -- brought in a soft hand to pinch you off the path. You grunted as her thumb pressed over your chest and slightly disrupted your breathing. Chara didn't really care about your name, it seemed. That was... worrying, somehow. You still weren't certain why this girl made you uncomfortable.

Chara stood upright, setting you in her open palm. You were so small that it would take several steps just to get from her wrist to the tips of her fingers. You shuddered.
"See, it's not so scary once you're off the ground." Chara said. At least you could agree with that. "Now sit tight."
You were again stopped from replying, this time as she closed her hand over you, leaving you in darkness.
It felt like no time at all before the thick fingers above opened up again. You blinked in surprise. You were in a building of some kind. How had she brought you here so fast...?
"Uhh, Chara...?" you said to her, putting the thought aside.
"Yes?" she replied, smiling.
"Do you... know any way to get me back to normal? Those monsters back in the park, maybe?"
Chara giggled, and the sound sent an unexpected chill down your diminished spine. "Of course! I can just go tell them, and I'm sure they can undo it."
You were surprised. "Oh-... G-Great! Let's do that now!"
"Mmm..." Chara tilted her head to and fro before looking at you again. "No." she said.
"... What...?" you responded, taken aback a bit. "No?"
"That's what I said." she confirmed. "I found you, so I think I'll hold on to you for a little while."
You blanched. "B-But-... I need to get back to-"
"Aww, whatever you need, you'll get there." she said soothingly, patting a fingertip on your head. You didn't feel assured.
1213311211.title: Meet Chara

choices: Chara slips her feet out of her boots.
"Take those clothes off, please." Chara requests.
Chara dangles you before her mouth, licking her lips.
12133112111.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

"Play" with you...?
This girl just watched you shrink to barely any bigger than a bug, and her first thought is "I want to play with this helpless person"?
No wonder you got a bad vibe from her.
"Chara," you began, "I'm not safe like this, I need you to-"
"Y'know," she interrupted, shifting her hand and making you fall over, "I think I prefer 'Miss Chara', just for you, actually."
You pushed yourself upright, muttering an "OK..." under your breath, "Miss Chara, I need you to help me get back to normal, and I'm not gonna let you treat me like a toy or something-"
Chara interrupted yet again with a little giggle. "Oh, don't be that way." she said, smiling and sitting down in a chair. "It's not like you're the one in control here."

The ominously threatening way she spoke had the effect of shutting you up quite quickly. You glanced around, but there wasn't any way you could hope to get away from her. Her hand was well off the ground, leaving a drop all around.
"OK, no complaints? Great!" Chara said in your silence. "We'll get started right away."
12133112111.title: A girl and her human

choices: She drops you into her sock, as promised.
She scoops you up and drops you into her boot.
121331121111.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Chara shifted one way and then the other on her chair, slipping her feet free of her boots. She had socks with the same colour of stripes as her hoodie on beneath them. She lowered herself to the floor, keeping you steady.
You yelped in panic when she flipped her hand, letting you drop to the carpeted floor. You were directly between her feet now.
Her legs spread around like a high wall, and her feet were at least as tall as the average one-floor building. Instantly the smell of her worn socks hit you, and you recoiled.
Chara giggled and brought her feet together, nearly crushing you between them. She stopped just short, leaving you in a thin gap between her two soles. The smell became overwhelming; you coughed, staggering, and bumped against her right foot. Immediately, she brought its twin in against you, squashing your helpless body between the two.
You could still hear her giggling as she kneaded at your pitiful frame with her feet, working you up to her toes. Once there, the digits assaulted your body, pummeling you all over. Sweat stuck to your body, accumulating quickly.
Eventually, she forced your upper body into the gap between two toes, letting you break for air. You gagged, leaning out of the gap. Chara's face loomed before you. She still had that same damn smile.
"You're doing great!" she said with mock encouragement. "Keep that up, and you might graduate to the inside of my sock!"
You would've shouted a reply if the scent of her toes weren't still clogging your lungs.

The world flipped upside down, and Chara slammed your body to the carpet, pinning you under a single foot. Your arms and up were still free, but it wasn't much help.
"Mmm..." she cooed, gazing down at you with delight. "Care to give me a kiss, right down there?"
You gagged and managed to shout at her, but it wasn't distinct. She just set a hand against her cheek, watching. You weren't getting out of this.
"Just one kiss..." she encouraged you.
The scent was so bad that you hated the idea of opening your mouth for any reason, but Chara had you hooped.
Dragging yourself forward, you forced your mouth against the fabric of her sock, directly between her two largest toes. The sweat was awful and stale on your tongue.
Chara giggled once more at the sight.
121331121111.title: Chara's footprint

choices: Sadly, yes. Chara squeezes the life out of you.
Not quite. You black out, but Chara keeps you alive.
Not today. Chara unexpectedly releases you.
1213311211111.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

You were beginning to feel lightheaded. There was a dull pounding in the back of your head as the vast young woman pinning you down gave another self-satisfied giggle. The sound was infuriating.
"So sweet of you..." she cooed in that same awful voice. To your surprise, Chara's foot lifted away from you. You groaned, trying to sit upright. Your body was horribly sore.
It took you a moment to realize that Chara was up to something. She'd rolled backward a bit and was tugging her sock off of her left foot. You worried that she might be about to introduce you to her bare foot instead. Whatever she was planning, you were in no position to stop her.
Her smile only widened once she'd slipped her foot free and she returned her gaze to you.
"C'mon up to me." she said cheerfully, closing her thin fingers over your body. You struggled to push the digits away, but it was a losing game.
The girl angled you downward in her grip to see what was about to happen. She was spreading the opening of her sock wide with her other hand, directly beneath you.
"I don't think I'll be able to hear you in there," she said, "So, anything you want to say before that?"
You could barely work up the energy to shout at her, between your soreness and your new terror.
"Ch-Chara, please-!!" was all you could manage.
"Mmm..." she mumbled, twisting your body around for a moment. "I'll think about it..." she said. Without anything further, her fingertips released you.
You gave a strangled yell, tumbling straight into the opening of the long sock. The colourful fabric billowed around you. With a light impact, gravity brought you to your destination.
"Oof-!"
The interior of the sock felt like a strange sort of hammock. Considering the stale odour and the confinement, though, it was much more frightening than relaxing.
Your hands clutched pointlessly at the fabric, as if it could provide some sort of aid. There were no holes in the sock that you might have been able to wriggle through to escape.
"I hope you can make some space in there." Chara's cheery voice cooed, "Your roommate is coming back in."

The light filtering in from high above at the sock's opening was blocked out. A very large bare foot was pushing its way back inside. Toes larger than your whole body rushed toward your position, and in entirely too little time, they struck your body once more.
Chara pinched you securely between her two largest digits, and you could instantly feel the difference that being inside her sock made. Her skin was soft, but the sweat layering its surface made your own feel clammy with its touch.
The scent returned in full force, and between the fumes permeating your limited air and the feeling of Chara's toes assaulting your body and demanding your total submission, you couldn't make out the words she was saying from beyond your prison.
The torture went on, Chara treating your frail little body as nothing more than a bit of lint to squeeze and toy with. Your senses were beginning to abandon you as the seconds dragged on.
Slow thoughts drifted across your mind. Was this how your life was going to end? Were you about to die between the toes of a cold-hearted young woman like your life meant nothing?
1213311211111.title: Promise fulfilled

12133112111112.content:
You couldn't take the onslaught caused by Chara's playing anymore. She was playing much too dangerous for your small body. It became really bad when one of toes came and landed directly on to your face. The toe pushes you back into the sock and you struggle trying to breath. You were suffocating by Chara's toe. No matter how much you move, she would not let go. Finally you couldn't take it anymore and you passed out from lack of air.

When you finally came to once again, you felt something poking your Body. You open your eyes to see Chara's hand poking you, in order to wake you up. "Oh Good your awake, I thought you might of died" Chara said cheerfully. You look up to see the smiling face of Chara. A face that you really hate now. You couldn't hold in your anger anymore "What the hell is wrong with you Chara! I just wanted your help but you obviously would want to torture me rather than help me!" Chara looked at you with more confusion then anything, that was until she smiled again "What are you talking about, that was fun" "No it wasn't!" "Yes It Was" "No It Wasn't!" "Yes It Was"

You've had enough of this "Just drop me on the ground and I'll get someone else's help, someone nice" Chara didn't like this as she turned her hand into a fist. Letting only your head being shown. Chara drops her smile and give you an emotionless face "No, we haven't finished playing, and you will stay here until we finish. Do you understand?" Chara then squeezed you in her fist, causing pain to course through your body "Ahhhhhh Yes Yes I understand!"

Chara stopped squeezing and smiled again "Good, now for the next game i think we can play ____________
12133112111112.title: Chara Is Mean

choices: Wants you to go into her sock

Quickly, Chara takes you in her hand and moves you close to her mouth.
"H-hey, what the-" you were not been able to finish your sentence, because the giant Girl placed you inside her mouth.
"Mmm..." Chara said, enjoying herself. "You taste even better than chocolate..."
"C-Chara, please..." You said, feeling her saliva all over your body.
But the girl wasn't even listening. she was playing around with you with her tongue, moaning at the same time.
After 5 minutes, which for you, felt like 5 years, she spat you out.
Luckily, you landed on her bed. You looked at the Giantess.
"Why would you do that!?" you shouted.

"And we only started playing." She said.
After that, Chara...
121331121113.title: Quite tasty, for a human...

choices: It's a girl. She has dark hair, and a blue-and-purple striped shirt.
A boy, dark hair, with a worn-out blue-and-purple striped shirt.
1213311213.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

It was strange, but in the moment that you took in the towering human's features, you felt calmed, in a way. They stared back at you on the ground with curious eyes.
1213311213.title: A certain human

choices: "There were some monsters back over there. The shot came from them."
"I... I'd kinda like to just rest somewhere before we go looking, OK?"
12133112131.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

"Wow..."
The girl's soft voice was loud, on account of her size, but it carried an immediate impression of kindness in its tone. You were still scared, but you didn't run.
"I've never seen this happen to a human before..."
The girl was stooped in front of you, examining your diminished body on the footpath before her. She had gentle eyes, the colour of chocolate. A little smile tugged at her lips.
It took you a moment, but you suddenly jumped in place, realizing that you recognized this girl. She was the one who freed the monsters! You struggled for her name.
... C'mon, you knew this -- she was only one of the most important people in the world...!
"... Hi." came her soft voice again. You returned your attention to her. Your neck was beginning to hurt from gazing straight upward. "Who are you?" she asked.
You weren't focused, your mind still rushing in all directions, but you stammered your name to her all the same. She smiled.
"Well, you can just call me Frisk." she said.
Frisk, that was it. You felt stupid for forgetting.
"How did this happen to you, if you don't mind me asking?" Frisk inquired, sitting down on the footpath. You tried not to look at anything below her midsection -- she was wearing a pretty short skirt.
"I-... Uhh..." you stammered for a moment. After a breath, and with Frisk just watching you gently, you spoke again. "I... got hit by a stray blast of some kind of magic. I don't know exactly who fired it."
Frisk sighed patiently. "Ooh, that's bad luck." she remarked. "I could ask around, if you like. It might not be easy, though. Shrinking magic is popular with monster kids."
"If you do find them, could they fix it?" you asked.
"Probably." Frisk replied. "If they know what they're doing, whoever hit you should be able to reverse this. Here..." Extending a hand to the ground, she offered her palm to you.
You hesitated, but clambered onto her hand all the same.

"Hey, Frisk...?" you inquired once she was standing. She looked at you.
"Yes?"
12133112131.title: Meet Frisk herself

choices: "I live alone, so it'll be nice and quiet." Frisk says.
"That's the place. Maybe I should introduce you to Mom...?" Frisk says.
121331121312.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Frisk looked you over with concern, but smiled after a moment,
"OK, little guy." she said. "I actually don't live too far away. Why don't we head to my place?"
"I'd like that." you replied.

Frisk settled you up on her shoulder, indicating her shoulder-length hair for you to hold onto.

 

"We're almost there." Frisk said. You'd been trading chatter back and forth while you traveled. There wasn't much to tell about yourself, compared to Frisk. She was the one who fell into the Underground and wound up freeing the monsters seven years ago! She'd just been a kid then. Your best guess was that she'd be eighteen or nineteen now.
You looked at the place Frisk was pointing toward. A small house.
121331121312.title: With Frisk

choices: "Actually..." you say nervously, "I... Could I stay a while longer...?"
1213311213121.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Frisk's house was small, at least to a normally-sized person. As she brought you inside, you immediately noticed a large number of pictures all over the walls of the warmly-lit home. All manner of pictures containing both Frisk herself and a vast collection of monsters could be catalogued all over the place.
"I hope you like it." Frisk said. She entered what seemed to be her living room.

 

The following hour saw Frisk helping you to get comfortable. She offered some food, but you were feeling alright.
"Honestly, I'm kind of amazed Mom agreed to let me move out." Frisk said, still enjoying a conversation about your own lives. "She's the best mother you could ever want, but it took a lot of convincing.
You'd seen a few pictures of Frisk's mother by now; A monster you'd seen on TV, her name was Toriel. She looked like she was halfway between a goat and a fuzzy rabbit.
"Hmm..." Frisk muttered, looking at her hanging clock. It was... a very interesting clock. Judging by how all the numbers and arms seemed to be floating on their own, you guessed it was made by magic. "It's starting to get late... We should probably head out and find the monsters you saw back at the park. They can tell us who accidentally hit you."
She was just setting aside the mug of hot chocolate she'd been drinking. You thought things over.
1213311213121.title: One-to-one care

choices: In the morning, you go out for your search.
Next morning, you ask Frisk if you can stay a while longer.
12133112131212.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

Frisk paused, looking at you. You were standing on her knee.
"You... want to stay with me?" she inquired.
"I-If it's not gonna be a problem." you added, thinking you might be overstepping something.
"Oh-. No, it's OK." she said, sounding just as nervous all of a sudden. "I don't mind at all. This could be fun!"
Maybe "fun" wasn't the word you'd use, but you'd feel safer with someone like Frisk for now. It was getting late, and you didn't love the idea of being out there in the cold wind at this size, even with Frisk to carry you.

Frisk cleared away her drink and set you on her table, sitting in a chair.
"So, if you're gonna stay with me tonight, you'll need somewhere to sleep, huh?"
You felt strange about the way she said that. She'd been very gentle and helpful up until now, but the way she said that particular sentence... it almost sounded flirty, in a way.
... Probably nothing, you figured.
"Yeah." you replied. "Something you have in mind?"

 

Not too much later, you found yourself resting on a very soft surface indeed -- Frisk's stomach, which was covered by a set of fuzzy pajamas, made a very comfortable bed.
"Don't worry," she said, "I don't roll around at all, so you won't get squished or anything."
Again, there was something odd about the way she sounded, but you didn't give it much thought. You were just tired, was all.
12133112131212.title: Her new roommate

choices: "I think it's time for bed." she says, blushing as well.
"Umm... Actually, you can keep going..." she says, smiling nervously.
121331121312122.content:
-A story route requested by another user-

You felt embarrassed to explain why you wanted to stay with Frisk in the morning, instead of looking for whoever caused you to shrink. She was understanding, though. She just smiled and agreed, setting up a breakfast for both of you.
One day's stay became two. Then three, then nine, then...
Well, at some point, the two of you stopped counting. What would you call this arrangement, exactly? Frisk owned her little house on her own, so you weren't a tenant. A roommate, maybe?
Well, in any case, you lived here as much as she did by now. You enjoyed your new arrangements, even if your tiny size caused some problems here or there. Frisk was endlessly helpful. Actually, there was something almost strange about her; sometimes, you'd find yourself in danger, only for Frisk to appear almost out of nowhere to protect you. Just earlier this evening, you'd almost been crushed by a book tipping over, but Frisk suddenly caught it just before it could flatten you, even though you thought she'd been out of the room already.

She was keeping an eye on you right now, in any case. It was a warm evening, and Frisk was wearing her pajamas and socks already, watching TV with you seated on her footrest. She was considerate enough to keep her feet clear of your position, as she doubted they smelled very good after what she'd been doing today.
She was just giggling at something Mettaton had just said on the TV when your attention was drawn to the pair of feet to your right, crossed over one another. Her toes wriggled, their shapes poking through her socks.
You felt awkward, just watching her feet like this, but they were... Well, there was something you found appealing. It was hard to explain.
"Uhh, hey, Frisk?" you found yourself asking before you could stop yourself.
"Hmm? What's up?" she asked, lowering the TV's volume to hear you.
"I-...Uhh, sorry, it's just..."
You had no idea how to ask this discreetly. Maybe just be direct...? Frisk had never gotten mad at you before. She was probably the most patient person you'd ever met.
"I... OK." you tried again. "Could I... massage your feet?"
...
The TV seemed silent in the pause that followed your request.
Frisk looked straight at you, and you felt like curling up into a silent ball and never speaking again.
"... OK, sure?" she said uncertainly. She set her feet separately on the footrest, and you approached, almost too eagerly. You slowed down, reminding yourself that you didn't want to weird her out.
You took a position before Frisk's left foot. It was a fair bit taller than you, upright like this. Her toes just wriggled idly.
Placing your palms against her sock's soft fabric, you gently began to work at her skin. It was warm, and the smell wasn't half as bad as it could have been.
You kept going for a few seconds before leaning around her sole to look up at her face.
"Hey, just checking -- can you feel this?" you asked. You wondered if her sock might be too thick for your very small hands to have any effect.
Frisk hesitated. "... No, actually." she said. "Here..."
She reached down, grabbing at the end of her sock and tugging it off.
You took a step back, looking over her bared sole. You weren't about to hell her out loud, but she had some very, very nice feet.
Returning to her sole, you got back to work.
Frisk giggled in the distance. Was she ticklish...?
You had a sudden idea. You pressed yourself right up against her sole, putting your whole body into the effort. Your arms traveled to and fro, massaging all they could reach. You set your face against her smooth skin, loving the feeling of her contact.
On and on you went, until you heard Frisk's voice through her laughter.
"H-Hey, don't get too ahead of yourself-!"
You paused, realizing what you'd been doing. A patch of dampness marked the place where you'd just been placing your tongue. Your face melted into a luminescent blush. You hadn't realized just how into it you'd been.

Frisk loomed over you.

121331212.title: Oh boy!

choices: A wooden post. (Papyrus's perpetually full mailbox)
1213312121.content:
You pushed yourself through the waist-high snow, the freezing substance having dampened your clothes significantly. Your thick shirt stuck to your skin with the water, your arms folded around your chest in a fruitless attempt to trap some heat.

It had been about 3 days since this ordeal began, you had been taking a mountain hike to clear your head, when your foot was caught on something. By the time you realized this, you were already plummeting towards the distant ground, though luckily a surprisingly large flower broke your fall. It was easy to see a gigantic room around you, which opened into a garishly pink structure, all buried beneath the rock.

Although that was bad, it didn't come close to comparing with the freezing wasteland you encountered next, There didn't seem to be much at all, other than the trees and the snow, a black sky looming ominously above. Your eyes were almost entirely shut, the frigid winds entirely unpleasant to experience. Your lack of sight caused you to find yourself bumping into...

122231.content:
Papyrus hadn't thought trying to clean Sans's room would end up leading to the discovery of some forgotten experiments. He definitely hadn't known he'd end up becoming absolutely tiny. He needed help. No matter how much he didn't want to admit it, he needed help. The treck to Sans's bed took ages. Everything was so much bigger and so much further away. Thank goodness Sans had been too lazy to actually make a bedframe. The matress itself was going to be hard enough to climb onto. He took it step by step, hand hold by hand hold, until he had finally climbed on top of it. Now, when Sans came to take a nap, he would be found.

Sans yawned, standing beside his station, and decided to teleport to his room.
122231.title: Big Brother Sans

1222312.content:
Papyrus jumped at the sudden arrival of his brother. Sans hadn't even bothered to use the door. He opened his mouth to call out to his brother, but instead settled for trying to run for his life. Sans hadn't just not noticed him, Sans was laying down right now without bothering to glance at the bed itself. He failed to get out of the way in time, but at least Sans wasn't too heavy. "SANS, GET OFF ME!" he shouted as loudly as he could. There was a quiet chuckle. "SANS, I AM NOT JOKING!"

"aw, come on, bro. it's not that bad." Sans chuckled.
1222312.title: Oh I, uh, /TOTALLY/ didn't see you there

choices: Papyrus falls asleep in the face of boredom (and sans)
12223122.content:
Sans rolled to the side, reverently picking Papyrus up. "so, uh, any reason you thought the bed was a good place to hide, bro?"

"I WAS JUST HOPING TO AVOID BEING TRAPPED IN YOUR FILTHY ROOM!" Papyrus folded his arms, looking cross. "BUT I'M ALREADY REGRETTING HAVING EXPECTED HELP."

Sans felt his smile falter a bit. "hey, come on, bro. i always got your back, ok? you're just really fun to tease, that's all." he said softly.

Papyrus looked up at him sulkily before sighing. "JUST… NO MORE LAYING ON TOP OF ME…"

Sans felt his smile come back and winked. "ok. i won't." he agreed.

Papyrus closed his eyes, taking a deep breath, and then yelped as he was suddenly in motion. "SANS!!" he shouted, annoyed.

"heh, relax, paps. not lettin' you outta my sight, so you're staying with me. and right now? it's nap time." Sans chuckled, bringing his little brother to his hoodied chest like a teddy bear.

Papyrus squirmed. "NO! I REFUSE TO BE SO LAZY!" he protested, trying to push away.

Sans yawned, snuggling Papyrus closer, and shushed him. "you don't gotta sleep if ya don't wanna, but /I am/." Papyrus pouted, but Sans was fast asleep mere seconds later.
12223122.title: Brotherly Nap

choices: Sans gets a nice, lazy day
122231221.content:
Papyrus fidgeted in his boredom, trying to stay awake and not submit to Sans's laziness, but the sound of Sans snoring soon drowned out all conscious thought. It wasn't loud. Sans was, to his knowledge, incapable of being loud. But it was constant and a sound Papyrus associated with sleep. Slowly, his eyelids began to drift shut.

Sans yawned, sitting up. Glancing down, he found Papyrus napping against his arm. He chuckled, gently tucking Papyrus into his pocket. He wasn't going to wake Papyrus from his well earned nap. That wasn't his way. Instead, he opted to laze in the couch until Papyrus woke.
122231221.title: A Good Rest

1222312212.content:
Sans took pleasure in the lack of responsibilities while Papyrus slept. He didn't have anywhere he needed to be anytime soon, and, even if he did, Papyrus wasn't about to make him go. He lazed about on the couch, drank nearly five bottles of ketchup, and just enjoyed himself. He briefly considered going to Grillby's, but taking his brother, even if he was the only one who would know Papyrus was there, to a place Papyrus didn't like going, felt like an overstep in boundaries. He may love picking on his little brother, but he wasn't about to push him too far. When he finally got bored, he spent some time exchanging knock knock jokes with his friend behind the door, keeping them just a little quieter so not to wake Papyrus. A few hours in, he felt movement in his pocket. He said a quick goodbye, one hand holding Papyrus still so not to risk him fumbling his way out of the pocket, throwing an excuse over his shoulder as he headed to his post.

Papyrus woke to quiet voices and a stuffy, albeit soft, space. He shifted, trying to get out, only to suddenly be pinned down. "Sans!" he shouted, hoping he would be heard, as he tried harder to get free. "Sans!?" he shouted again, concerned by the lack of response. He kept shouting and struggling, but fell silent when something grabbed his legs. He gave a brief cry of panic as he was dragged out.

Sans blinked at Papyrus, hanging upside down from his fist, breathing hard. "Uhhh… whoops." he said awkwardly, setting Papyrus carefully on the counter of his station. "Didn't mean to spook ya, bro." Papyrus glared up at Sans, unhappy. "You okay, paps? i didn't hurt ya, did i?" he asked softly, looking closer to check for any possible damage he may have caused.

"Never do that again." Papyrus said sternly. "I had no idea where I was or what was going on!"

Sans flinched slightly. "Sorry. Didn't think of that… just thought you'd be more comfortable in there…" he mumbled.

"I forgive you, Sans, just don't do it again."

"I won't." He sighed, straightening up a little. "But I gotta go to my other sentry post."

12231211.title: Sans falls asleep.

122312221.content:
Sans sighed. He should have been more careful. He was usually good with lab safety, but this had gone from a good day to shit in less time than it took to even think the word 'shit'. He had planned to make a chemical to make the human tiny, that way maybe he would be able to stop them for good. Instead, the concoction had become gaseous and he had been forced to teleport into the main house before he got too small. Now, he was stuck on the table with his pet rock hoping Papyrus would get home soon. After about ten minutes of sitting there, beside the rock, with no other plan, he had fallen asleep. Today had been busy, after all, even for a lazy bones like himself.

Papyrus came inside. Sans was missing, and, like the incredible brother that he was, he was /terrified/. He had searched everywhere but his own home. The entire underground. Including Asgore's home. Though, now that he considered it, he hadn't checked the Ruins. That door was always sealed, after all. If he didn't find Sans here, he would just have to find some way into the Ruins. He started his search upstairs, nearly breaking down the door to Sans's room before remembering he had a key. Sans wasn't in there. He checked his own room, desperation more at fault for that hope than any real thought process. No Sans in there either. He slunk back down to the living room, about to head into the kitchen, when he heard soft snoring. He froze, focusing on the sound, and then began searching out its source. A very tiny doll of his brother sat beside the rock. Was their pet actually snoring now? He hadn't known their rock would take after Sans's sleeping habits. "Sans…" he sighed worriedly.

"Hmm…?" Sans hummed sleepily, eyes opening at the presence of a loud voice.

Papyrus froze, tensing, and focused on the doll. Its eyes were open. He screamed.

"AAAHH!" Sans screamed back, hands covering where his ears would be, if he had ears. At least Papyrus was finally home.
122312221.title: Safety (at least for now)

choices: Papyrus get mad at sans for being careless

The two continued screaming at each other for a few minutes. They were both just a bit freaked out, after all. Papyrus quieted first, and Sans followed soon after. Papyrus inched closer, eyes locked on the seemingly sentient doll. "S-Sans?" he asked a little anxiously.

Sans blinked. He hadn't thought this through. He should have at least stood on something higher up so Papyrus didn't look quite so much like a tower. He realized Papyrus was waiting for him to say something. "Sup, P-Paps." he greeted. Papyrus's hands began approaching and he tried to get out of the way, but there wasn't anywhere he could escape to. He was swept into the massive palms and lifted up.

Papyrus stared in awed horror at his big brother. "S-Sans… wh-what happened to you?" he asked worriedly.

Sans relaxed quickly. Papyrus wouldn't hurt him. Not ever. And he knew that well. Being this size was still making everything look like a threat, but he knew he knew better than to be afraid of Papyrus. "Lab accident. I'm okay, bro, just tiny." he assured Papyrus, who looked just a little relieved by this news.

122331.title: Alphys Shrinking

choices: She tries to get to the floor and away from Undyne.
She tries to wake Undyne personally.
Undyne begins to stir without help.
1223311.content:
It had to work this time, right? Statistically, the chances of failure were practically non-existent, but the past five attempts had all failed in one way or another, so Alphys was still unsure about this new run of her experiment.
The lizard monster shook her head.
"Confidence, Alphys." she muttered. She'd been working on her self-esteem ever since leaving the Underground, but even with the help of her many great friends, she wasn't quite over her past insecurities just yet.
She turned a few dials on the large machine before her. If all went well, the old instant noodle cup resting on the footstool before the machine would become very hard to see in a few moments.

Waiting for the machine to warm up, Alphys looked toward the other end of her lab. Her girlfriend, the fish-looking monster Undyne, was enjoying a power-nap on the worn couch opposite the work area.
Undyne was the gym teacher at Toriel's human-monster school, and as school had just let out an hour ago, Undyne was happy to drop by her girlfriend's lab, though not so eager as to skip out on the chance for a nap while Alphys finished her day's work.
Alphys blushed, remembering the nearly aggressive kiss Undyne had pulled her in for upon her arrival.

The machine let off a soft beep to indicate readiness. Alphys carefully aimed a funnel-shaped component at the old noodle cup and pressed one last button. The machine whirred to life and let off a jet of light from the funnel.
It struck the noodle cup instantly.
"Goodbye, garbage." Alphys said, watching eagerly.
Just as she hoped, the noodle cup began to visibly distort for a moment before starting to diminish in size. Alphys hit the button again to stop the process.
"Yes! Yes yes yes!!"
She practically jumped off the floor in excitement at the success of her experiment. Approaching the stool, she looked over its surface.
She spotted the noodle cup. It was barely the size of a bit of dust.
Alphys couldn't contain her joy; this experiment had taken weeks, but now it was a success.
She wanted to tell someone, even if Undyne was the only one around. She headed for the couch, where Undyne was still sprawled lazily, snoring away.

Alphys was right next to the couch when she froze, hearing a loud hum from across the room.
"Wait..." she mumbled, turning on the spot.
The machine was active again.
"No no no!!"
There was a flash of blinding light, and Alphys felt a strange sensation all over her body.
And then she was falling.

She hit the ground, scrambling quickly back up.
Oh no.
She could still see the machine, but it was so far away...
The beam had somehow been briefly activated again, and she'd been caught in it.
A roaring sound broke into the air, causing her to jump with a startled yell. She spun around.

She was on the couch, apparently. Looming high over her was the barely-moving and truly gigantic form of Undyne.
Her girlfriend was lying on her side, one of her muscled arms resting over her chest. At this scale, Alphys could make out the patterns of scales lining Undyne's skin with ease.
Another terrifying roar echoed from Undyne's mouth as she continued to snore.
Alphys didn't know what to do.
1223311.title: A Little Alphys

choices: Undyne's eye opens and spots her.
She's got the eyepatch side. Undyne wakes up but doesn't notice her.
12233112.content:
Two things were clear to Alphys at this moment.
One, she was scared out of her mind. That was a natural consequence of her situation.
Two, she needed someone's help right now. The idea frightened her even more, but the only real choice at the moment was Undyne. The towering fish monster loved her more than anything -- a fact that never failed to make Alphys blush furiously -- and was her best bet in finding safety at her diminished size.

So, to wake her up.
Undyne let off another very loud snore. She wouldn't be waking up easily without some help of her own.
Alphys hesitantly approached her girlfriend's upturned arm. Her bicep alone was taller than Alphys was. She took a shaky hold on one of the scaly sections of Undyne's arm and tried to lift herself up.
Another loud snore, and Alphys suddenly felt very intimidated by the sight of Undyne's teeth. They were very large and very sharp -- two qualities that were only accentuated by Alphys' own presently unimpressive size. Sure, they looked wonderful in Undyne's big smile, but right now?
She tried to ignore the sight as she scrambled onto Undyne's upper arm. Her girlfriend's dark red hair was draped over her arm just a bit here. She planted her feet and addressed Undyne's sideways face. She tried to speak, only for her voice to come out as a tiny squeak.
Clearing her throat, she tried again, forcing herself to be louder than normal.
"Uhmm... U-Undyne?"

1223333111.content:
Frisk hat just completed one of Mettaton's shows and was heading to the core. The conveyor belt he was standing on led him to a long and dark room encased in spiderwebs. He heard a soft feminine giggle echo through the room, but Frisk stayed determined and continued walking down the long hallway.
"They said that a human wearing a striped shirt will come over here." the feminine voice said "I hear they hated spiders" she continued. "Not me" Frisk said to himself, he loved everything.

"I heard they like to stomp on them" said the voice. "Not usually..." Frisk thought to himself. Frisk's pace started to slow down, as he was having trouble walking due to all of the cobwebs.

"I heard they like to tear their legs off" the voice spoke again. Whoever this woman was she obviously never met Frisk, he was the most lovable thing in the world! Most of the time.

"I heard..." the voice said. Frisk then stopped, the spiderwebs had completely enveloped him up to his shoulders. "That they are really stingy with their money" the voice continued.

The room then lit up and the source of the voices was revealed. It was a spider girl with 7 eyes, that was wearing a short red dress. "You think your taste is too refined for our pastries, don't you deary ?" she said. " Ahuhuhu... I disagree with that notion. I think your taste... Is exactly what this next batch needs!" she continued. The room then started to flash white, which usually indicates that a fight is going to happen. But for some reason it didn't? When Frisk opened his eyes again he was back at the same room again. The only difference was that the spider girl was now gone."This isn't right, she couldn't have just disappeared. She must be somewhere in this room" Frisk thought to himself.

He then started to struggle hoping to remove the webs that were restricting his movement. After a few minutes he was free once again so he started investigating. He went to the spot where the spider girl used to be. He then heard a faint voice:"Hey human!". Frisk then turned around only to find that no one was behind him."Down here, human!" the faint voice spoke again. Frisk the followed the instructions and looked down. Standing in between his shoes was the spider girl, only much, much smaller. "Great now we can..." the spider woman said only to be interrupted by Frisk quickly grabbing her. Frisk then moved her in front of his face to get a better look at her.

What does he do now?

info.brief_description: Size adventures with the denizens of the Underground.
info.description:
Welcome to the Undertale Growth & Shrink interactive.
Here you'll find what you'd expect from size content, but with an Undertale flavour.

There's not much else to say to describe it.

Many of Undertale's characters are age-ambiguous, so we'll keep this fairly simple. No overtly sexual content involving the ones who are clearly children.
Beyond that, knock yourself out, though please try and be coherent. If I edit anything, it'll just be to improve general readability and remove anything that breaks the rule above.
